In addition to the requirements of Level II and Level III individuals must have expert-level knowledge and experience in software design and architecture and be capable of analyzing and decomposing activities/requirements to software designs that are allocated across product teams, systems components/sub-components, classification system levels, etc. This position will collaborate with a team of engineers and administrators supporting our clients DevSecOps program. Conducts research in design, development, testing and utilization of electronic data processing software. Designs, develops, documents, tests and debugs applications software and systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conducts multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers and/or hardware engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determines computer user needs; analyzes system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. Ensures software standards are met. Analyzes user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. Confers with systems analysts, engineers, programmers and others to design system and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces. Designs, develops and modifies software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and consequences of design. Coordinates software system installations and monitors equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Required Skills:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>8 years experience of non-internship full-stack development to include Java, Web services, Database, and/or web application development</li>\n<li>5 years experience with agile and lean philosophies</li>\n<li>5 years experience with DevSecOps tools and processes such as Git, Concourse, SonarQube, Fortify and ThreadFix</li>\n<li>3 years experience with container technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes</li>\n<li>3 years experience doing XP, CI/CD Integration, and Test Driven Development (TDD)</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Required Skills:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Rapidly design and document information system solutions through flow diagrams or other visual tools</li>\n<li>Time management, work with a team of engineers and management personnel to produce integrated prototype systems on or before given deadlines</li>\n<li>Active problem-solving skills, enthusiastic learning, understanding of new technologies and techniques and apply this information to current and future projects</li>\n<li>Critical thinking, and logic skills to outline the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, systematically selecting the optimum solutions for the give problem</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Global InfoTek, Inc.</strong> is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About Global InfoTek, Inc.</strong> Reston, VA-based Global InfoTek Inc. is a woman owned small business with an award-winning track record of designing, developing, and deploying best-of-breed technologies that address the nation's pressing cyber and advanced technology needs. We do this through driving education, and are the largest driving school in the United States. We are a people-first organization, and our technology sits at the root of the industry-leading experiences we deliver to our customers. Everything we build is done to improve the lives of our students and instructors, often as a direct result of the feedback they give us. This collaboration between engineering, product, instructors and students is what has allowed us to grow fast while maintaining the highest standards.</p>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">About our stack and team:</div>\n<p>Our customers, both instructors and students, interface with our services through our React (TypeScript, NextJS, Apollo, GraphQL) web-app backed by Firebase services. As a full stack engineer, you will play a critical role in developing our services, making architectural decisions, and ensuring the security and scalability of everything we build. You will tackle complex engineering problems in a small team working alongside Coastline's founders who have built the service from the ground up. We deploy code multiple times a day so the work you do this morning could improve someone's life this afternoon.</p>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">You will:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Have a high level of autonomy to work on our React/NextJS web application</li>\n<li>Take concepts and ideas to production and improve the product experience for our customers</li>\n<li>Be one of the first non-founder engineers at a high-growth startup, with long-term career growth opportunities</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">You are:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Collaborative by nature - For remote engineers, working on GMT +/- 2h timezone is required.</p><br><p><strong>Your profile: </strong>We are seeking self-motivated people to join our engineering team — and the infrastructure team in particular, bringing with them solid technical skills and the desire to build highly resilient, performant and durable cloud architecture.</p><br><p>The correct candidate needs to possess a strong demonstrable background as an infrastructure engineer (or similar role involving infrastructure responsibility), including:<br><br></p><p></p><ul><li>Several years experience building and maintaining infrastructure for modern web applications</li><li>Extensive knowledge of cloud infrastructure, especially AWS</li><li>Being comfortable in an environment where all changes are made via infrastructure-as-code (we use Terraform)</li><li>Experience with APM (we use Datadog)</li><li>Experience in building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines</li><li>Effective communication with technical and non-technical people</li><li>Attention to detail; you believe if a job is worth doing, it’s worth doing right</li><li>A commitment to documenting technical decisions and features</li><li>A security-minded approach to everything they do</li><li>A passion for automating repetitive tasks</li></ul><br><p>Bonus points for having experience with the following technologies:</p><br><p></p><ul><li>Hashicorp Vault and Consul</li><li>Docker</li><li>Ansible</li><li>PHP and Javascript</li><li>Elasticsearch</li><li>GitHub Actions</li></ul>\n https://remotive.io/job/609752/logo

margin-bottom: 20px; font-size: 28px;">\n<div class="h2">Who You Are</div>\n</div>\n<section class="av_textblock_section">\n<div class="avia_textblock">\n<ul>\n<li>You reside and work in Europe (GMT to GMT+2)</li>\n<li>You’re an experienced software developer, you have written and deployed a production application more than once. You have strong experience with React, next JS, SaaS applications, headless CMS and eCommerce.</li>\n<li>You can relate the technical benefits and constraints of a platform to business requirements and are willing to embrace problems by non-technical shareholders and incorporate their requirements.</li>\n<li>3+ years experience in a Fullstack, Enterprise Technical Pre-Sales/Solution Architect role (or similar). It’s easy for you to map business requirements to a technical solution and come up with a plan on how to achieve</li>\n<li>Experience in working cross-functionally with Sales, Customer Success, Engineering, Operations, and Product teams</li>\n<li>You have the ability to help developers successfully integrate with our companies platform</li>\n<li>You are a proactive team player, comfortable presenting in person as you are via conference call and web demo platforms</li>\n<li>You’re good at networking and getting in touch with others quickly</li>\n<li>Possess the attitude and skills to survive in a complex and highly dynamic remote environment – and you know how to grow this attitude in your co-workers</li>\n<li>Have good written and verbal communication skills in English</li>\n</ul>\n</div>\n</section>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class="av-layout-grid-container entry-content-wrapper main_color av-flex-cells avia-builder-el-24 el_after_av_layout_row el_before_av_layout_row submenu-not-first container_wrap sidebar_right" id="av-layout-grid-4">\n<div class="flex_cell no_margin av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-26 el_after_av_cell_one_fifth el_before_av_cell_one_fifth" style="vertical-align: top; padding: 30px;">\n<div class="flex_cell_inner">\n<div class="av-special-heading av-special-heading-h2 blockquote modern-quote avia-builder-el-27 el_before_av_textblock avia-builder-el-first av-inherit-size" style="padding-bottom: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; font-size: 28px;">\n<div class="h2">Our Values</div>\n</div>\n<section class="av_textblock_section">\n<div class="avia_textblock">\n<p>Our team strives to constantly improve itself following these values:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Make an Impact:</strong> We’re here to change the industry and we’re in it to win it. We’re incredibly focused and our main focus is on customer success. We boldly go out of our comfort zones, we support each other and we love doing what we do.</li>\n<li><strong>Thirst for Learning:</strong> We’re addicted to learning and we learn from everything. We embrace our failures as they’re something we can learn from and only help us to improve. We think differently and we know that change is good. We’re curious and innovation leads the way, we’re constantly on the lookout for new ideas that can help our customers (and the world).</li>\n<li><strong>Diversity Rules:</strong> We’re proud to be a diverse team spread across the world. We empower the under-represented and we build a safe community for everyone to be themselves while holding each other to account when needs be. We use asynchronous communication as we’re a remote company and need to be aware that we’re not always online at the same time.</li>\n<li><strong>We’re In This Together:</strong> As colleagues, with our customers, and with our communities, co-operation and collaboration is key. We help one another as much as we can and we care for each other. We celebrate our successes together and we strive to find the right balance in our lives.</li>\n<li><strong>Transparency First:</strong> We make all information as public as possible and we’re direct (as well as truthful) in all our communications. We don’t just explain what we’re doing but why we’re doing it. This is how we create positive relationships and move forward together.</li>\n</ul>\n</div>\n</section>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class="av-layout-grid-container entry-content-wrapper main_color av-flex-cells avia-builder-el-30 el_after_av_layout_row el_before_av_layout_row submenu-not-first container_wrap sidebar_right" id="av-layout-grid-5">\n<div class="flex_cell no_margin av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-32 el_after_av_cell_one_fifth el_before_av_cell_one_fifth" style="vertical-align: top; padding: 30px;">\n<div class="flex_cell_inner">\n<div class="av-special-heading av-special-heading-h2 blockquote modern-quote avia-builder-el-33 el_before_av_textblock avia-builder-el-first av-inherit-size" style="padding-bottom: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; font-size: 28px;">\n<div class="h2">How We Work</div>\n</div>\n<section class="av_textblock_section">\n<div class="avia_textblock">\n<p>We’re a <strong>remote native company</strong> with regular in-person meetings. We make intensive use of tools like Slack or video conferencing. We try to find a good balance between focused work and communication or in other words between asynchronous and personal communication. There are no fixed expectations regarding working hours, it’s normal for us to take care of private matters during the day – e.g. visits to the doctor or picking up children from school.</p>\n<p>Our team strives to improve themselves following these guidelines:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>We offer a <strong>friendly learning environment</strong> and try hard not to blame anyone for not knowing something and actively encourage mentoring of your peers.</li>\n<li>We use practices like co-working and pair programming when it makes sense to keep the amount of knowledge debt low.</li>\n<li>As a company, we continuously refactor our rules and guidelines. Overall, we have a very transparent, helpful, warm, familiar employee culture.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We’re an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If we receive job applications from yet underrepresented groups those applications will be preferred where multiple candidates have the same score.</p>\n</div>\n</section>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class="av-layout-grid-container entry-content-wrapper main_color av-flex-cells avia-builder-el-36 el_after_av_layout_row el_before_av_layout_row submenu-not-first container_wrap sidebar_right" id="av-layout-grid-6">\n<div class="flex_cell no_margin av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-38 el_after_av_cell_one_fifth el_before_av_cell_one_fifth" style="vertical-align: top; padding: 30px;">\n<div class="flex_cell_inner">\n<div class="av-special-heading av-special-heading-h2 blockquote modern-quote avia-builder-el-39 el_before_av_textblock avia-builder-el-first av-inherit-size" style="padding-bottom: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; font-size: 28px;">\n<div class="h2">Your Package</div>\n</div>\n<section class="av_textblock_section">\n<div class="avia_textblock">\n<p>We have put together a package for our employees which we think is pretty awesome, but you can judge for yourself.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>€52,921.09 – €61,123.86 (FTE), pro-rata</li>\n<li>Company laptop</li>\n<li>An expense policy to support you in creating your workspace in a way that is most effective for you</li>\n<li>Flexible working as standard, as long as you are available when needed and your work gets done, you are free to choose your own schedule</li>\n<li>Contribution towards your private medical insurance where health insurance is not mandatory/organized at the government level</li>\n<li>Allowance for your home office, or for a co-working space</li>\n<li>42 days of paid leave entitlement, including public holidays.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Since we currently work from 13 different countries (and counting), it’s very difficult to offer consistent benefits beyond this.</p>\n</div>\n</section>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class="flex_cell no_margin av_three_fifth avia-builder-el-44 el_after_av_cell_one_fifth el_before_av_cell_one_fifth" style="vertical-align: top; padding: 30px;">\n<div class="flex_cell_inner">\n<div class="av-special-heading av-special-heading-h2 blockquote modern-quote avia-builder-el-45 el_before_av_textblock avia-builder-el-first av-inherit-size" style="padding-bottom: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; font-size: 28px;">\n<div class="h2">We’d Love to Hear From You</div>\n</div>\n<section class="av_textblock_section">\n<div class="avia_textblock">\n<p>If this Customer Success Engineer role sounds interesting to you, please send a short tweet-style “why-me” to people@frontastic.cloud and have your CV attached (as pdf).</p>\n<p>Do you still have questions? 28 592250 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/qa/application-penetration-tester-592250 Application Penetration Tester Pivot Point Security QA [] full_time 2021-04-21T08:00:58 USA Only <p><strong>Do you like puzzles? Do you live, sleep, and breath App Sec? Are you an advanced and experienced Application Penetration Tester looking for the next step? And finally, and most importantly, can you communicate complex issues to a client in a way anyone might understand?</strong></p>\n<p>Then maybe, you’re the one we’re looking for. We need technically competent team players, that love application security, have a natural thirst for knowledge, and aspire to share this gift with our team and clients. The right candidate never accepts second best but instead is always looking for a smarter way, lives our core values, and is as comfortable talking with a business analyst about the application’s usage as they are about session entropy or CSRF with a developer.</p>\n<p>We are looking for the “right” person to join our team as a Senior Level Application Security Assessor/Penetration Tester. The right person is highly experienced with application security testing, including OWASP ASVS knowledge, and possesses superior written and verbal communication skills that will provide clear and actionable guidance at an appropriate level to clients in a consultative fashion to best mitigate Application Security risk.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements</strong></p>\n<p><strong>We expect this person will:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Conduct penetration testing of web, mobile, web services, and thick client applications.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Candidate should be able to perform manual exploitation of vulnerabilities.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Recognize, document, and report vulnerabilities and kill chains, describing remediation activities with the ability to effectively articulate and communicate the results in both technical and layman terms to the appropriate audience.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Your writing should effectively explain to Grandpa what is wrong with the application.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Provide sales team with technical and security expertise in support of business development activities. Participate in sales calls, helps scope projects, provides pricing estimates, and creates pre and post-sales documentation.</li>\n<li>Receive work assignments and timelines from the Practice Lead. Maintain routine cadence with the assigned Project Manager to ensure all interested stakeholders are up-to-date on project status and sound the alarm before any potential interference of meeting those deadlines.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Provide guidance and leadership as it relates to Application Pen Testing.</li>\n<li>Meet/exceed defined goals for the services you deliver.</li>\n<li>Achieve target Net Promoter Scores by meeting/exceeding client expectations.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>The right person HAS the following characteristics:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Personal integrity, a highly transparent nature, and a mindset of “mutual benefit.”</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Occasionally mistakes happen, you’re human (we hope). We expect you to own it, learn from it, and not repeat it.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Thrives on and is worthy of self-managing the projects they are responsible for (micro-management is a four-letter word at PPS).</li>\n<li>Has very high “Self-Expectation” (self-motivated, self-aware, self –disciplined, self-improving, and self-governed). You hold yourself to a higher standard than others do.</li>\n<li>A willingness and desire to learn. We understand that nobody knows everything. However, the right person has an inner drive to learn new things and share their knowledge.</li>\n<li>Enjoys work and life, values a balance, and is looking for a company that shares those ideals (understands that you do not get a second chance to see your child’s first school play and that it does not matter if the report gets done at 3 PM or 10 PM, if it gets done).</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Highly consultative and collaborative nature; someone who enjoys helping others achieve ambitious business and information assurance goals.</li>\n<li>Effectively and proactively communicates in writing/speech both internally/externally from the server room to the board room.</li>\n<li>The ability to “work from anywhere” as this role is remote/virtual.</li>\n<li>A good sense of humor and the ability to laugh at themselves.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>The right person has the following experience:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Demonstrated a solid understanding of application security, including the OWASP top 10 and the OWASP ASVS with experience in discovering, verifying, and exploiting these vulnerabilities.</li>\n<li>5 plus years of verifiable and significant application security auditing and penetration testing experience (with a preference toward ASVS assessments) and well-written deliverables that paint accurate stories our clients can understand.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>In lieu of OWASP ASVS experience, experience in assessing application security architecture and/or code review is acceptable.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Demonstrated knowledge of and ability to create Proof-of-Concept exploits for common vulnerabilities (and be able to narrate the issue, exploitation, and remediation in simple, easy to understand language):</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>XML External Entity (XXE) Exploitation</li>\n<li>Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)</li>\n<li>Injection style vulnerabilities such as SQL and command Injection.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Ability to discuss vectors for sensitive data exposure within various web application frameworks.</li>\n<li>Demonstrated knowledge of Page Controller, Model View Controller, and single page application design/architecture and the difference in approach required for testing.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Demonstrated knowledge of the common approaches to remediating OWASP Top 10 and ASVS identified issues.</li>\n<li>Working knowledge of SDLC best practices.</li>\n<li>Experience with API penetration testing.</li>\n<li>Experience with programming or scripting languages such as; Python, Ruby, Java; data structures such as XML &amp; JSON; and protocols &amp; communication methods like SOAP, REST, AJAX, etc.</li>\n<li>Demonstrated communication and presentation skills, to include the ability to effectively work with clients in a consulting environment.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><br><strong>The right person often has one or more of the following attributes (these are negotiable):</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>A demonstrated understanding of application development.</li>\n<li>Experience as a developer and/or secure coding best practices in a mainstream language.</li>\n<li>Ideally, 3 years in a leadership role or one with supervisory/oversight responsibilities for a staff of Pen Testers.</li>\n<li>Experience performing Secure Code Reviews.</li>\n<li>Experience or willingness to perform public speaking.</li>\n<li>Offensive Security Web Expert Certification.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Offensive Security Certified Professional Certification</li>\n<li>Offensive Security Certified Expert Certification.</li>\n<li>CREST Register Penetration Tester.</li>\n<li>CREST Certified Web Application Tester.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>GIAC Exploit Researcher and Advanced Penetration Tester (GXPN) certification.</li>\n<li>GIAC Penetration Tester (GPEN) Certification.</li>\n<li>GIAC Web Application Penetration Tester Certification.</li>\n<li>ISC2 Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP).</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Benefits</strong></p>\n<p>We’re a small, but growing, company. So, we do our best to keep the right people at PPS (most of our team has been together for 6+ years) by aspiring to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>A high-performance work environment with extremely passionate, driven, and experienced technical professionals. At Pivot Point Security, you will find colleagues you can learn from and respect.</li>\n<li>A management system where all employees participate in establishing the company’s goals/initiatives and have ready visibility into the company’s performance. We’re working hard to create processes and metrics to measure our, *and your) success.</li>\n<li>An environment where relationships are important, internally, and externally. We provide the highest levels of customer service and strive to always exceed our clients’ expectations.</li>\n<li>A competitive salary (more than most) with a F100 level benefits package (e.g., medical, dental, vision, HCFSA, 401K w/ company match, vacation and personal days).</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Providing individuals, the opportunity to develop by giving them the resources required, surrounding them with great colleagues, and allowing them to take on new/big challenges.</li>\n<li>Work location flexibility.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>As a company, we:</strong></p>\n<p>1. Tell the Truth (Honesty is almost always the best policy)</p>\n<p>2. Do the Right Thing (Keep commitments, over-communicate, be transparent, confident, worthy of/thrive on freedom)</p>\n<p>3. Smile (Life is too short not to … likeability is nearly as important as competence)</p>\n<p>4. Seek “Win-Win” (Think cooperative, not competitive - seek mutual benefit in all interactions)</p>\n<p>5. Provide Clear and Actionable Guidance</p>\n<p>6. Simplify</p>\n<p>7. Are Customer Focused</p>\n<p><a class="external" rel="nofollow"><br></a>At Pivot Point Security, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our community. Pivot Point Security is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.</p>\n NaN

for a <strong>Senior Mobile Engineer</strong> to join our extensibility team, which is responsible for maintaining all our various integrations, including for Android and iOS.</p>\n<p>At PostHog, we are a small (but growing) remote <a class="external" href="https://posthog.com/handbook/company/team/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">team</a> building an open source platform that empowers customers to create successful products.</p>\n<p>Until now, tools for building products have been fragmented, Product analytics, heat maps, session recording and A/B testing all provide immense value, but existing tools weren’t natively built to work together.</p>\n<p>PostHog is different by offering these tools (and more) in a single platform that customers can host themselves.</p>\n<p>We started PostHog as part of Y Combinator’s W20 cohort and had the most successful B2B software launch on HackerNews since 2012 - <a class="external" href="https://posthog.com/handbook/company/story" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">with a product that was just 4 weeks old</a>.</p>\n<p>We are proudly backed by some of the world’s top <a class="external" href="https://posthog.com/handbook/strategy/investors" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">investors</a> and believe in product-led growth, where we build something awesome and let your product bring the users, rather than an outbound sales team and regular cold calls.</p>\n<p>We have a lot of capital, but we’re a lean, strong team - so you’ve got the opportunity to have a huge impact.</p>\n<p> Expo, ...)</li>\n<li>Adding support for new features in existing integrations, e.g. add feature flags into all mobile libraries</li>\n<li>Building new integrations when needed, for example we need to build a pure-JS Expo (React Native) integration, our current React Native integration uses native code</li>\n<li>Improving our integration testing and deployment infrastructure</li>\n<li>Assuring we meet all privacy and compliance requirements set by Apple and Google, so that people using our libraries won't get their apps flagged</li>\n<li>Work on the rest of the PostHog platform in the Extensibility team, e.g. by improving our plugin server</li>\n<li><a class="external" href="https://posthog.com/handbook/company/values#tread-on-toes" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">Tread on toes</a> systems</li>\n<li>A high level of proficiency in both Java and Objective-C</li>\n<li>Ideally, you'll have a high level of proficiency in Swift, Kotlin and JavaScript</li>\n</ul>\n<p> 31 588229 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/software-dev/front-end-developer-588229 Front-End Developer Cove Software Development [] full_time 2021-04-21T07:59:38 Singapore <p><strong>About Cove</strong>: Cove is the new way to rent your home! We're a co-living start-up making it easier and more affordable for people to rent rooms. We provide our tenants with stylishly furnished properties, in the most awesome locations in Singapore and Jakarta and make the whole rental process seamless from end to end. Our contract terms are flexible like our tenant's lives and our rental prices include everything from utilities and wifi and weekly cleaning. Our tenants get matched with great flatmates and also have access to our community events around the city. Check us out at <a href="https://cove.sg/" rel="nofollow">cove.sg</a> or <a href="https://www.cove.co.id/" rel="nofollow">cove.co.id</a>.</p>\n<p><strong>Job Title: Front-End Developer</strong></p>\n<p><strong>Job Type: Full Time</strong></p>\n<p><strong>Reports To: Head of Technology</strong></p>\n<p><strong>Role Purpose:</strong> This role will support web development initiatives in the Company.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Develop and maintain company website initiatives.</li>\n<li>Collaborate with other Tech team members to design and develop products.</li>\n<li>Manage to produce clean and maintainable code.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements: </strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Holds a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/ IT/ any relevant major.</li>\n<li>Have 3-5 years' work experience as a front-end developer from any industry.</li>\n<li>Have min. 3 years using JavaScript and React.js.</li>\n<li>Preferred to have Redux/MobX, SASS/ SCSS, Webpack/ PostCSS, SSR/ SSG, SOLID, and Git.</li>\n<li>Able to perform responsive web design and testing</li>\n<li>Proficient in using English, written and verbally.</li>\n<li>Able to work independently and attention to details</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What's in it for You:</strong></p>\n<p>Working for Cove gives you the opportunity to join an exciting young start-up incubated through <a href="https://slack-redir.net/link?url=http%3A%2F%2FAntler.co" rel="nofollow">Antler.co</a>. Each of our team members are hugely influential in our ability to do this, as well as in the culture and growth of our company. As our first Business Intelligence Engineer, you will drive BI throughout the company as the start of our data team. You will work cross-functionally to build tools and capabilities to enable data-driven decision making, and craft analysis to influence company strategy. Reporting to the CTO, you will have wide-ranging responsibilities across business intelligence, analytics, and data engineering, and be pivotal in laying the foundation for the future of our data team.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What you are like</strong></p>\n<p>You are highly analytical, independent, curious, self-driven, comfortable with ambiguity, and able to identify signal from noise.</p>\n<p>You are very comfortable diving deep into complex data and approach data analytics with an engineering mindset.</p>\n<p>You are a critical thinker, asking the right questions and helping other to do the same.</p>\n<p>You take initiative to understand the needs of various teams and surface the best data to support the business and drive growth, spearheading new data initiatives where we're lacking data.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p>\n<p>Own BI in Looker</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Build out LookML models and explores</li>\n<li>Create dashboards and workflows to surface key data to each team</li>\n<li>Build embedded analytics experiences for customers</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Enable teams to make data-driven decisions</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Work across teams to identify opportunities to leverage data to solve their problems</li>\n<li>Execute on specific data/reporting requests</li>\n<li>Create &amp; train others on self-serve analysis tools</li>\n<li>Foster a data-driven culture</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Unlock value in our existing data</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Uncover patterns of user data</li>\n<li>Collaborate with our research partners on R&amp;D projects</li>\n<li>Moderate data engineering to produce usable data assets</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Strong creative, analytical thinking</li>\n<li>Highly skilled with SQL</li>\n<li>Understanding of relational data modeling and warehouse design</li>\n<li>Experience with BI tools such as Looker</li>\n<li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li>\n<li>Self-directed &amp; self-motivated; able to work effectively without clear requirements</li>\n<li>3+ years professional experience in BI or BA, engineering, or a related data-centric discipline</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Bonus</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Data engineering experience with dbt or Airflow</li>\n<li>Experience with Python or Javascript</li>\n<li>Experience analyzing SaaS product usage data at scale</li>\n<li>Experience analyzing event-based product analytics</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Our data stack includes: MySQL, Stitch, dbt, Redshift, Looker, Amplitude, Segment</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About Cloverleaf</strong></p>\n<p>Think about the best team you've ever been on. How could you ever recreate that? That's what we do with our technology. Cloverleaf unlocks the mystery behind high performing teams. We combine assessment data to draw out insights and deliver ongoing coaching through the tools your team uses every day. With no extra effort, this coaching conditions your team to grow stronger and improve performance over time. Because when your people know where they belong, your team thrives. color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Builds defined features</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Writes code to solve problems in a team environment</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Writes testable, maintainable code</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Provides architectural guidance and feedback and implementation support</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Performs analysis and provides feedback on reported defects, and implements solutions</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Writes effective, automated tests</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Follows and improves the development process</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Mentors peers and junior team members</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Performs thoughtful code reviews and provides constructive, positive feedback with the interest of improving code quality, performance, and building the team</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px; text-decoration-line: underline;">Communication</span></p>\n<ul style="padding-left: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; margin-left: 30px !important; list-style-position: outside !important;">\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Communicates effectively through emails, Slack, etc.</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Gives proactive status updates</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Ability to present structured fact-based arguments</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Values collaboration with their own team and others</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px; text-decoration-line: underline;">Critical Thinking</span></p>\n<ul style="padding-left: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; margin-left: 30px !important; list-style-position: outside !important;">\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; font-size: 16px;">Balances short-term needs with long-term goals</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Thinks about what could go wrong and how we can mitigate the risk</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Identifies blocking issues</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Helps define requirements</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; vertical-align: baseline; color: #04aed9; font-size: 18px;">Work Environment</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; The majority of tasks will be performed while sitting at a desk.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; border-width: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; list-style-type: circle; list-style-position: outside !important; margin: 5px !important 0px 0px 30px !important;">\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">The ability to lift or push your suitcase</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Ability to carry/lift up to 25-50 lbs of presentation materials for customers or for conference presentations, etc.</span></li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px; text-decoration-line: underline;">VISUAL &amp; TACTILE REQUIREMENTS</span></p>\n<ul style="padding-left: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; margin-left: 30px !important; list-style-position: outside !important;">\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Ability to view computer screens for significant periods of time</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Ability to use a laptop keyboard with accuracy</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Ability to hear at normal levels and through electronic devices such as laptops, earbuds, phones, and the like</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #04aed9; font-size: 18px;">Experience </span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">We are looking for a developer who has the ability to become familiar with and navigate an existing, mature code base with relative ease. The right candidate should be able to identify and mitigate potential risks with code changes, as well as, provide thoughtful solutions to integrating with existing and new services.</span></p>\n<ul style="padding-left: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px; margin-left: 30px !important; list-style-position: outside !important;">\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Experience with PHP and custom WordPress development is required</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Familiarity with SaaS platforms</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Source control (Git, Mercurial, etc.)</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Unit testing and TDD</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Agile methodologies (SCRUM, Kanban)</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Familiarity with CI/CD processes</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Knowledge of software architecture and design</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Experience working in a remote capacity</span></li>\n<li style="margin: 0px 0px 5px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; line-height: 1.4 !important;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Experience in JavaScript, Python, and Go is a plus</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #04aed9; font-size: 18px;">Compensation and Benefits</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px; text-decoration-line: underline;">POSITION DETAILS</span></p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Structured as a full-time, exempt, and salaried position, this individual will report directly to Christopher Lamm, Director of Software Engineering. Compensation is commensurate with education and experience. Payroll is issued on a semi-monthly basis with salary on the 15th and last day of the month. </span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px; text-decoration-line: underline;">BENEFITS AVAILABLE</span></p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Group healthcare plans are available. The Art of Education University will contribute 100% for full-time health, dental, and vision, employee-only coverage. Family coverage is available at an additional premium.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">The Art of Education University offers participation, upon hire, of a 401K plan with up to a 4% match of employee contributions.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Appropriate and up-to-date technology is provided.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Unlimited self-managed PTO is offered to full-time members of AOEU. Extended vacations must be pre-approved. Flexibility exists so long as responsibilities are fulfilled and careful planning and communication are evident.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #04aed9; font-size: 18px;">Timeline</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px; text-decoration-line: underline;">THE PROCESS</span></p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Persons interested in applying should complete the application form linked below. Applicants are required to submit a short 1-3 minute video explaining why they would like to be considered for the position and why they are uniquely qualified. Failure to submit a video will automatically eliminate you from the application process.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Candidates who make it to Round 2 of the Application process will be required to complete a packet for review, prior to their scheduled interview time.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">Finalists will have one final interview with a member of the Senior Leadership Team.</span></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p style="padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; margin-block-end: 0px; color: #222222; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 15px;"><span style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; outline: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #404040; font-size: 16px;">The Art of Education University is committed to taking the time to find the right fit for our positions. This process may be more rigorous than you are used to. We have set up several interview steps to make sure this will be mutually beneficial to both our institution and our next new team member. CCRi provides a fun and challenging work environment, competitive pay, generous retirement, and a very flexible vacation policy. If you meet any of the qualifications below, we encourage you to get in touch.</p>\n<p>Remote Opportunities Available.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Roles and Responsibilities:</strong></p>\n<p>This is a customer-facing and high impact role. The Cloud Support Engineer is responsible for the total life-cycle of deploying cloud infrastructure used in CCRi’s technology platform. During the design phase of deployment, you’ll collaborate with the customer and CCRi project team to establish requirements and customization/configuration needed. Next during the implementation phase, you’ll work within one of CCRi’s supported cloud environments to stand up and configure components and software. Lastly, you’ll guide team processes and expertise to ensure that the platform meets contractual levels of availability and functionality by monitoring day to day operations. Ideally you’ve had experience working with production systems, been part of a support team, or both.</p>\n<p>The Cloud Support Engineer owns successful deployment of each project and keeps our customers excited to collaborate with us through enabling reliable, production systems.</p>\n<p>Responsibilities for the Cloud Support Engineer include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Working with the Program Manager, Project Technical Lead and the Customer, create technical plans for new deployments. You want to work with people, make a difference in their lives, and get the breadth of experience you can build a meaningful career on.</p>\n<p>You'll find what you're looking for here.</p>\n<p>We're MakerKids. We started the first makerspace for kids in the world, and now run award-winning virtual programs, camps and parties on coding, robotics and Minecraft. Our programs help kids develop confidence, social skills, resilience and a positive relationship with technology. We ignite kids' potential and inspire them to be inventors, entrepreneurs, and innovators. Kids have started businesses, won prizes from NASA, and had positive mental health outcomes.</p>\n<p>We've been featured in major media such as Wired, CTV and the Globe and Mail, and have spoken at SXSW, Maker Faire, MakerCon, and more. Right now, we're looking for a Designer, and we hope that's you.</p>\n<p>We're growing quickly, and we're looking for leaders to grow with us and ultimately drive our mission forward. We hope that you are our Product Designer.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Product Designer</strong></p>\n<p>We are looking for an ambitious Product Designer passionate about creating elegant designs and enabling seamless experiences that get users to "wow" .</p>\n<p>As our first Product designer, you'll be a key pillar in our team. You'll work with our CEO, software developer, and curriculum developer, and the whole team in order to gain a deep understanding of our users, craft effective designs and features to solve their problems, and bring our evolving website and product to life.<br><br>Families have been starved of quality STEM education that helps kids build soft skills and become creators, not just consumers. This role is an opportunity to bring a beautiful &amp; intuitive tool to people who desperately need it, and raise the bar of what is possible.</p>\n<p>With a strong culture of ownership and responsibility, we believe that our job is not done until the job is done. We take pride in delivering the highest quality, intuitive products that make discovering and actioning opportunities in the public sector effortless and fun for our users.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What you'll do</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Develop professional, beautiful, and more than anything, amazingly functional and intuitive designs for the website and the core features our customers use every day</li>\n<li>Design the UX/UI for our new web application (a registration software) and our new website, and ensuring future updates and features are accessible, beautiful, and functional. You will be both building the business brand and the components of the platform through immersive design.</li>\n<li>Run the customer development process with other team members. Organising, running, &amp; analysing user feedback and discovery calls</li>\n<li>Take hypotheses, user stories, &amp; customer insights and translating them into high (or low) fidelity prototypes, iterating on these ideas with customers &amp; the product team to arrive at your final designs</li>\n<li>Define, maintain, and iterate on our design system</li>\n<li>Research, collect, and digest best-in-breed design practices, and implement them here.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>This is a varied position, and if you have experience as a Product Designer, that variety will feel familiar. You'll have our full support to make changes that will make a lasting difference on our business.</p>\n<p>You're the right fit for this role because you have a customer-centric mindset, and are always looking for ways to improve marketing, or tackle high-leverage challenges to make things work better.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Working with us:</strong></p>\n<p>This is currently a part-time position - with the potential for long-term and full-time if things go well.</p>\n<p>With us, you'll enjoy:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Opportunities for growth and advancement</li>\n<li>Fun social events with the team like karaoke, escape rooms, improv classes, and other activities</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p>\n<p>If you have these, you'll be a great fit:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>2+ years of experience as a UI/UX designer, web designer or product designer (with B2C products is a plus)</li>\n<li>Deep familiarity with tools such as Figma / Invision / Sketch / Framer / Balsamiq to create prototypes, customer flows, and hi-fi mock-ups</li>\n<li>Experience designing and running key customer discovery tasks (eg. customer discovery interviews, concept and usability testing, etc.) and distilling the output into concrete insights and designs</li>\n<li>Effective communicator: Able to share novel or complicated concepts with the team in a digestible way, and able to “translate” messy customer signals into their relevant business implications.</li>\n<li>Focus on impact: Obsessively focused on how our product can solve our customers' problems. We do functional, not flashy.</li>\n<li>Attention to detail: Designs critiqued until pixel perfect. Every step of the customer journey accounted for. Nothing gets past you.</li>\n<li>Ambitious curiosity: Eager to learn skills and technologies outside of your comfort zone, take on tasks that scare you, and grow into a senior leadership role with us</li>\n<li>Dependability &amp; accountability: Trusted to deliver on the commitments you make to the team, from the big picture results to the nuanced details</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Anything on this list would be an asset:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Knowing enough HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, Node and/or Django to be dangerous</li>\n<li>Experience building and maintaining design systems</li>\n<li>Copywriting experience</li>\n<li>Experience building websites and ads that consumers love</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If this opportunity sounds like the meaningful, career-building challenge you've been looking for, we can't wait to meet you!</p>\n NaN

The role includes both responsive and static design for our growing research, events, podcast, and editorial divisions.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What you'll do: </strong></p>\n<p>• <strong>Web design and data visualization: </strong>Create digital mockups for ForeignPolicy.com with special emphasis on FP Analytics, our research and consulting division, and its clients, translating analyst reports and data into engaging, elegant, and informative designs for execution by our team of developers.</p>\n<p>• <strong>Events materials creation:</strong> Design static materials for events that anticipate platform-specific needs for use onsite, on social media, and during events. (Experience producing assets for virtual or broadcast events is a bonus.)</p>\n<p>• <strong>Brand vision:</strong> Iterate and improve FP's visual identity across divisions, including FP Analytics, events, podcasts, and editorial, along with other partner and client work.</p>\n<p>*This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement</p>\n<p>• 5+ years of experience producing content-based work for a media organization preferred. Candidates with newsroom or custom marketing experience is ideal.</p>\n<p>• A strong design portfolio showcasing art and typographical hierarchy and logic.</p>\n<p>• Ability to communicate responsive design solutions to developers, as well as our research, business, and editorial teams, using wireframe mockups or other prototypes.</p>\n<p>• Demonstrated experience parsing and translating complicated information into understandable, reader-friendly graphics and experiences across devices.</p>\n<p>• A pragmatic but innovative sense of the optimal user experience.</p>\n<p>• Familiarity with responsive web development — ideally experienced enough with HTML, CSS, and Javascript to build your own designs.</p>\n<p>• Proficiency with Adobe Suite products, especially Photoshop, Indesign, and Illustrator. (Bonus if you can shift us toward prototypes in Sketch and/or Figma.)</p>\n<p>• Ability to be self-led while collaborating closely and nimbly with a small team in a fast-paced news production environment will be essential to success in this role.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About us:</strong></p>\n<p><em>Foreign Policy</em> is a magazine of global news and ideas. Billions of metadata records flow through this system, making the impact of optimal improvements truly innovative. This magnificent challenge is a terrific opportunity to analyze DreamView's existing data and understand, model, simulate, optimize, and reshape one of the world's most complex systems as we transition to a GPU accelerated distributed data model.</p>\n<p>Your main focus will be on developing a query optimized unified data model, develop predictive models, assist in the development and prototyping of visualization, and support structures for data analysis to identify and evaluate opportunities to improve customer experience, production efficiencies, cost, the efficiency of capital investment, and the effective use of automation. You will identify effective metrics to quantify the improvements resulting from the application of your developed tools and you will evaluate the trade-offs between potentially competing objectives.</p>\n<p>The ideal candidate will demonstrate a deep understanding of statistical and machine learning concepts, technical skills for leveraging analytical tools to solve large-scale problems, technical aptitude to remain abreast with data science-related technologies, leadership in charting new analytical courses, and excitement to take iterative approaches to tackle long-term challenges. Depending on the role, you'll be involved in different parts of our product development process and work closely with both designers, product managers, QA and SRE to deliver compelling user-facing products.</p><p style='color: rgb(58, 60, 67); font-family: "Open Sans";'><strong>You can expect to get your hands dirty with:</strong></p><ul style='color: rgb(58, 60, 67); font-family: "Open Sans";'><li>Be part of important product discussions, and discuss with product managers, ux designers and other engineers</li><li>Migration from monolith to microservice architecture</li><li>Build a design commenting system ala Figma</li><li>Build and improve on our Chat and Collaboration system (Superchat)</li><li>Built integrations towards other services in the design space</li><li>Build out our project management platform</li><li>Improve on our staffing system</li><li>Build version control for design assets</li><li>Architect efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex web applications</li><li>Architect efficient, scalable and highly available back-end systems that drive complex web applications</li><li>Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues</li></ul><p style=""><br><font color="#3a3c43">Check out the video below to get a sneak peak of our DesignOps platform and a look and feel of the product you'll be working on 🔍</font><br><font color="#3a3c43"><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WlZc10j_eDo" rel="nofollow">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WlZc10j_eDo</a></font><br><br></p><p style='color: rgb(58, 60, 67); font-family: "Open Sans";'><strong>THE TECH STACK</strong> </p><p style='color: rgb(58, 60, 67); font-family: "Open Sans";'><strong>Frontend</strong></p><ul style='color: rgb(58, 60, 67); font-family: "Open Sans";'><li>NodeJS</li><li>Lambda Edge</li><li>Next.js/ React</li><li>Styled Components</li><li>Typescript</li><li>Sanity Headless CMS</li></ul><p style='color: rgb(58, 60, 67); font-family: "Open Sans";'><strong>Backend</strong></p><ul style='color: rgb(58, 60, 67); font-family: "Open Sans";'><li>Java/Kotlin</li><li>Spring Boot 2</li><li>Hibernate/ AWS RDS / MySql</li><li>Redisson/Redis</li><li>Junit for testing</li><li>ElasticSearch</li></ul><p style='color: rgb(58, 60, 67); 92 566584 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/software-dev/backend-engineer-566584 Backend Engineer Koyo Software Development [] full_time 2021-04-08T01:46:50 Within 3 hours of London <p><strong>Who we are</strong></p>\n<p>The current system of credit, based on bureau data, is deeply unfair, penalising people who live in lower income areas, people who are new to the country or customers who have used high risk products in the past (such as payday loans). Koyo (www.koyoloans.com) was founded in 2018, on the principle that everyone should have access to affordable credit regardless of where they are from, where they live, or types of credit that have used.</p>\n<p>Many seeking credit are charged excessive fees and interest rates for borrowing that cause financial problems, rather than solve them. We’re changing all that.</p>\n<p>Koyo uses innovative technology to offer fairly priced credit to millions of UK customers. We’re based in London, with global ambitions. Koyo is backed by leading venture capital funds (the same funds that backed the likes of Revolut, Transferwise and others) and some of the most reputable angel investors in the UK. Join us, and help put an end to predatory financial firms and be part of an exciting and rewarding journey.</p>\n<p><strong>Our story so far</strong></p>\n<p>In 2016, Thomas, the founder of Koyo moved to the UK and found accessing credit to be difficult if not impossible. This is because his credit history did not follow him from his home country. He realised that having an imperfect credit history affects millions of people who are new to the country, but also people who have failed to build a credit history in the UK more generally. We raised our first round of venture funding in September 2018, a seed round in October 2019 and will raise our series A in the first half of 2021.</p>\n<p><strong>What you’ll be doing:</strong></p>\n<p>We have a small, highly skilled fully remote technical team led by our experienced CTO. You will join this team in developing the early versions of our lending product, our back office systems and credit decisioning engine. You will be given a lot of ownership, responsibility and freedom. Our tech culture is summarised in two tech blog posts at <a class="external" href="https://blog.koyoloans.com/tech/koyo-technology-culture-part-1/" rel="nofollow">https://blog.koyoloans.com/tech/koyo-technology-cu...</a> and <a class="external" href="https://blog.koyoloans.com/tech/koyo-technology-culture-part-2/" rel="nofollow">https://blog.koyoloans.com/tech/koyo-technology-cu...</a></p>\n<p><strong><a class="external" href="https://stackshare.io/koyoloans/koyo" rel="nofollow">Our Tech Stack</a></strong></p>\n<p>The backend is primarily in Kotlin using Spring Boot and exposes a REST/JSON API. We use Google pub/sub for async messaging. The front end is a React/Redux webapp.</p>\n<p>On the infrastructure side, we are using Docker orchestrated with Kubernetes on GCP. Terraform is used to define the infrastructure as code. Source code and CI/CD is with GitLab. Gitlab is also used to manage the backlog and our light-weight Kanban process.</p>\n<p><strong>Requirements</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>This is a mid-level role and whilst years of experience is often not a good measure it is likely you will have 3-6 years of commercial experience.</li>\n<li>Technical excellence with strong experience of Java or Kotlin (Kotlin experience is not required as long as you are willing to learn).</li>\n<li>A desire to learn about the business and, with limited guidance, develop elegant solutions from high-level requirements. You will <em>not </em>be "spoon fed" detailed user stories.</li>\n<li>Entrepreneurial and excited about working at an early stage startup.</li>\n<li>A bias to doing things well whilst being pragmatic. Time to market is key.</li>\n<li>You have a growth mindset: You’re excited to learn new things every day and have a passion to inspire and grow.</li>\n<li>This role is fully remote (both pre and post Covid!). Your timezone needs to be within 3 hours of London.\</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Benefits</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Competitive salary.</li>\n<li>Equity in the business - you will own a part of the company that you are helping to build.</li>\n<li>Opportunity to shape the strategy and direction in a company with an important mission.</li>\n<li>Working with bright ambitious people who take pride in what they do.</li>\n</ul>\n NaN

Established in 2019 and headquartered in Oakland, CA, we are a group of game industry veterans who are passionate about delivering high quality casual competitive games that entertain players across all mobile platforms. We're proud to work with the biggest brands and leverage the newest technologies across all stages of development. We believe that success is built on three core values - Strong Player Communities, Experiences that Amaze, and making Games as a Lifestyle.<br><br></p>\n<p><strong>Position Summary:</strong></p>\n<p>As a technical artist you will keep the artistic vision intact while working within the limits of the software systems used on a video game production. You are also the connective tissue for the creative and engineering aspects of game development. You will work closely with the Game Designer, Lead Artist and Lead Programmer, advising on technical resources, researching new techniques, maintaining tools and pipelines, and preparing digital files of finished artwork to run efficiently without visual degradation. This role gets to do a little bit of everything from VFX elements, to light weight rigging and animation, to scripting and tool making, to pipeline development.</p>\n<p><br><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Developing and maintaining art resources, pipelines, and work flows in collaboration with a cross functional team.</li>\n<li>Solving complex technical issues during development</li>\n<li>Researching and developing technical tools for a project</li>\n<li>Working within the limits of the game engine, curating file sizes and loading speeds, and optimizing environments.</li>\n<li>Writing custom software specific to the needs of the game which will work with industry standard scripting languages</li>\n<li>Porting art to the game engine</li>\n<li>Creation of VFX elements and basic animations.</li>\n<li>Maintaining technical documentation</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>5 years of experience as a Technical Artist or related art role</li>\n<li>Creative mindset and ability to overcome technical challenges</li>\n<li>Excellent interpersonal skills help facilitate work and collaboration between creative and technical teams</li>\n<li>Solid understanding of game systems and the game development process </li>\n<li>In depth understanding of art and animation pipelines</li>\n<li>Experience with shader writing, rendering and post-effects</li>\n<li>High level artistic skills - proportion, color, composition</li>\n<li>Knowledge of coding languages such as C#, JavaScript, or Python</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Required Software Experience:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Unity</li>\n<li>Adobe Photoshop </li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Nice to haves:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience with AR development</li>\n<li>Experience with Deep Fake</li>\n<li>Blender / Maya / 3D Studio Max</li>\n<li>Unreal Engine</li>\n<li>SourceTree</li>\n<li>GitHub</li>\n<li>Adobe After Effects</li>\n</ul>\n NaN

you want</li>\n<li>We provide whatever tools you need to do great work</li>\n<li>100% of monthly health premiums covered</li>\n<li>Unlimited paid vacation</li>\n<li>401K plan</li>\n<li>Education and professional development opportunities</li>\n<li>Wellness benefits</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About Knapsack</strong></p>\n<p>At Knapsack, everything we do is steeped in the principles and practices of modularity, reusability, and component-driven software design and development. We dig into every opportunity, every challenge, every conversation with our core values top of mind:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Transparency: Operate with openness, communication, and accountability</li>\n<li>Mindfulness: Make specific and intentional choices, and be present in the moment</li>\n<li>Solution-minded: Appreciate challenges and work together to solve them, iterate often</li>\n<li>Co-ownership: Use our voices, drive, and experiences to find ways to improve</li>\n<li>Everyone Matters: Diverse opinions and perspectives lead to better outcomes</li>\n</ul>\n<p>If you share this vision, we'd love to work with you at Knapsack. Knapsack is an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.</p>\n NaN

Also open to candidates outside Australia working to Australian timezones in a contract engagement.</p>\n<div class="h4" style="font-family: inherit; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.1; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px; font-size: 18px;"> </div>\n<div class="h4" style="font-family: inherit; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.1; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px; font-size: 18px;">Work Environment</div>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 4px; line-height: 1.8;">This is a remote role working as a part of a global, distributed team spanning 5 continents. Most of your work will be asynchronous, with communication via Slack, JIRA, and Github, with a few video meetings per week. Most Client teams are located in North America, so expect some of your work time to overlap with North American working hours. Our project teams may include a Lead Engineer/Architect, UX Architect, Product Owner, Project Manager, Quality Analyst, and 1-4 additional Engineers. Engineers typically work on 1-2 projects at a time.</p>\n<div class="h4" style="font-family: inherit; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.1; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px; font-size: 18px;"> </div>\n<div class="h4" style="font-family: inherit; font-weight: bold; line-height: 1.1; margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 10px; font-size: 18px;">Community</div>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 4px; line-height: 1.8;">At XWP, you will become part of a much bigger community of X-Teamers from the X-Company brands, which is hundreds strong, and includes XWP, X-Team, and XFive.</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 4px; line-height: 1.8;">One of the ultimate perks of working at XWP is your Unleash+ membership, which gives you $2,500 per year to use toward activities that keep you energized so you can learn, grow and unleash your potential.</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 4px; line-height: 1.8;">Participate in our epic Seasons every quarter, designed to get you energized and doing more of the things you love to do. We'll constantly provide you with new, motivating side quests and challenges, spanning a range of Paths focused around your passions, like travel, coding, gaming, fitness, etc.</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 4px; line-height: 1.8;">Travel to work alongside other X-Teamers at one of our free hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world. The X-Outpost changes locations monthly, allowing people to explore &amp; work remotely in the most beautiful locations. Many XWP team members also meet up at WordCamp Asia, WordCamp US, and WordCamp Europe.</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 4px; line-height: 1.8;"><strong>XWP is an equal opportunity employer. font-weight: inherit; line-height: 1.4; color: #444444; margin-top: 40px; margin-bottom: 20px; font-size: 22px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 1.7; font-family: Roboto, HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue Light', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
