font-variant: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline;">1. Getting to know each other:</span> You’ll spend some time chatting with us over Zoom to learn more about the company and the opportunity. (~30 minutes)</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 20px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 1.7; font-family: Roboto, HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue Light', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; vertical-align: baseline; text-rendering: optimizelegibility; color: #444444; letter-spacing: 0.5px;"><span style="font-weight: 600; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline;">2. Skill assessment:</span> You’ll complete a technical interview with one of our lead engineers to help us learn more about your skills and strategic thinking. (~1-2 hour)</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 20px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 1.7; font-family: Roboto, HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue Light', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; vertical-align: baseline; text-rendering: optimizelegibility; color: #444444; letter-spacing: 0.5px;"><span style="font-weight: 600; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline;">3. Coding test:</span> We’ll provide you with a small test project or coding test that you complete on your own time (~3 hours)</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 20px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 1.7; font-family: Roboto, HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue Light', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; vertical-align: baseline; text-rendering: optimizelegibility; color: #444444; letter-spacing: 0.5px;"><span style="font-weight: 600; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline;">4. Personal conversation:</span> We would like to get to know you better. This conversation will be with our CPO (Benjamin). (~1.5 hours)</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 20px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 1.7; font-family: Roboto, HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue Light', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; vertical-align: baseline; text-rendering: optimizelegibility; color: #444444; letter-spacing: 0.5px;"><span style="font-weight: 600; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline;">5. Meet the team:</span> You’ll get to meet the other founders (Daniel &amp; Jan). We value team fit over everything else. (~30 minutes)</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 20px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 1.7; font-family: Roboto, HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue Light', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; vertical-align: baseline; text-rendering: optimizelegibility; color: #444444; letter-spacing: 0.5px;"><span style="font-weight: 600; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline;">6. Hiring decision/offer:</span> We are mindful of your time. Going through all stages can be done within one week. Once you’ve passed them all and we are both happy you will receive a formal offer.</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 20px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 1.7; font-family: Roboto, HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue Light', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; vertical-align: baseline; text-rendering: optimizelegibility; color: #444444; letter-spacing: 0.5px;"><span style="font-weight: 600; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline;">7. Final conversation (we would like to hire you):</span> We are going to chat about any concerns you might have, on-boarding as well as any other details to get you started. (~1 hour)</p>\n<p style="margin-bottom: 20px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 1.7; font-family: Roboto, HelveticaNeue-Light, 'Helvetica Neue Light', 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; vertical-align: baseline; text-rendering: optimizelegibility; color: #444444; letter-spacing: 0.5px;"><span style="font-weight: 600; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border-style: initial; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline;">We are lucky to hear from you! 🥳</span></p>\n NaN
116 396616 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/qa/qa-engineer-396616 QA ENGINEER Isobar Commerce QA [] full_time 2021-04-01T01:41:19 Bulgaria <p><strong>Sofia</strong></p>\n<p>Isobar Commerce (previously known as eCommera) provides global retailers with a single source for expertise, technology and operational support. We have a proven track record for delivering, managing and innovating multi-channel commerce platforms for major international brands and retailers including, Asda Direct, Clarins, Shiseido, adidas and many more. Our world-class team has delivered sites for over 25 brands with more than 170 sites across 34 markets.<br><br>As part of a global expansion strategy, the company has set up a key Sofia technology team of Software Architects, Software Developers, QA Engineers, Project Managers and Technical Support Specialists. <br><br>During the pandemic, we managed to grow our <strong>ISOBAR TEAM</strong> with more than 30+ talented people and we proudly continue the search for new passionate members for our Quality Assurance Team.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES: </strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Actively participate in the planning, implementation and maintenance phases of a project</li>\n<li>Identify test conditions from project documentation and develop and document test cases and test scripts to cover those conditions</li>\n<li>Execute test scripts, record results and perform detailed initial root cause investigation</li>\n<li>Assist in analyzing the results of the automated tests execution, as well as maintain and extend the automated scripts’ coverage</li>\n<li>Work with Technical Leads, Business Analysts and Solutions Strategists to review project documentation such as Product Backlogs, Functional Requirements, Technical Specifications, etc.</li>\n<li>Work with Technical Support and Developers to resolve any defects identified</li>\n<li>Ensure timely and regular communication to all team members</li>\n<li>Share knowledge and ideas with the team</li>\n<li>Work independently and as part of a SCRUM team</li>\n<li>Assist in the production of daily, weekly and monthly QA managerial statistics, e.g. defects by project, area, severity, etc.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>3+ years of commercial experience in testing Web and Client/Server applications</li>\n<li>Exposure to automated testing; professional experience with Selenium will be a huge advantage</li>\n<li>Deep understanding of the best practices in creating system test scripts, test execution and defect reporting/tracking</li>\n<li>Experience in testing web applications across different platforms and browsers</li>\n<li>Strong troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills</li>\n<li>Critical thinking and ability to collaborate with a team on urgent issues resolution</li>\n<li>Understanding of the following Web technologies: HTTP(S), S/FTP, Web Services (SOAP, RESTful)</li>\n<li>Possess contagious passion about quality</li>\n<li>Very good verbal and written English</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Desirable Skills / Experience: </strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Understanding of performance testing principles and best practices</li>\n<li>Good programming skills in one of the following languages: JAVA, PHP,</li>\n<li>JavaScript, C++ and understanding of OOP principles, data structures, etc.</li>\n<li>Experience of web usability, i18n and accessibility testing and the corresponding Another fortunate side-effect is that some requests are completely automated using ML. 💬 + 📦 = ❤️</div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>We've been around since 2015, and we're currently serving over 6000+ e-commerce businesses, including Steve Madden, Timbuk2, and Fjällräven.</div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>Is getting your hands dirty, in a real-world application that touches the lives of millions, your thing? Then yeah, Gorgias is for you.</div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>This position is either fully remote (Central European timezones) or onsite at our Paris office (75011). We offer relocation for those interested. </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><span style="font-size: 18px;">👩‍💻 <strong>What are some of the things we work on?</strong></span></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>The frontend is written in <strong>React</strong> and React Native with the state managed by <strong>Redux</strong>. The backend code is mostly written in <strong>Python3 </strong>and runs using <strong>Flask</strong> (REST API) and <strong>Celery</strong> for all background work. The state is stored in <strong>PostgreSQL</strong> and <strong>RabbitMQ</strong> with <strong>Redis</strong> for ephemeral storage, and finally, everything runs on <strong>Kubernetes</strong>.</div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>Given the above, we usually work on one of these levels by improving the existing code, or we create a new feature which more often than not has a component on both frontend, backend, and maybe a migration in the database.</div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>In short, we do full-stack development. Either way, it always good to have a good understanding of the entire stack to be effective.</div>\n<div> </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><span style="font-size: 18px;">🧙 <strong>Who are we at work?</strong></span></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>We have a strong preference for people who worked with <strong>high-traffic web applications</strong> for the past <strong>5+ years</strong>. We're essentially running a distributed system that has lots of moving parts and having a decent amount of experience with this type of system helps a lot!</div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>Additionally, our apps have over <strong>20k daily active users</strong> with sessions longer than <strong>6h+/day</strong> and serve <strong>tens of millions</strong> end consumers per year, so we put great importance on quality, testing, and code-review of all our code. Our apps have big codebases, and we have to feel comfortable about navigating and progressively improving them. Sometimes, however, we gotta get dirty and figure out why the DB is slow or why some k8s pod is not running correctly, figure out how to successfully retry a failing API request, etc... The end goal is to hide a lot of complexity from the user and make their life easier.</div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>If this is the type of environment you're looking for, then you should consider applying.</div>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Who You Are</div>\n<ul>\n<li>5+ years of experience developing production-grade backend web applications using Python or JS.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>3+ years of experience doing front-end development with JS.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You are passionate about learning, and want to help us learn too.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You care about working on applications that are putting the customer needs first.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You are comfortable communicating with other technical teams and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, demo work in progress and provide project updates.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You have the drive and focus to get challenging projects over the finish line, and you are comfortable advocating for what you need to do your best work.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You thrive in a fast-paced environment.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Nice to Have</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience in designing API/microservices is a huge plus.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience with managing RDMS databases with Tb+ of data.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Company Benefits &amp; We’re building infrastructure to automatically capture customer interactions on web and mobile applications, make sense of them, and make them actionable for anyone. We want to enable everyone to understand their millionth customer as well as they understood their first.</p>\n<p>We’re looking for experienced full stack engineers to join our Insights team to enable Heap’s customers to understand and take action on their data. The team spans everything from frontend UX and visualizations to the backend SQL query engine, and works closely with the Data Science team to translate new analysis concepts into user-facing features. On this team, you’ll work cross-functionally with engineers, designers, and product managers to understand our customers and bring new analysis features to market. This is a quickly-growing product area with a huge opportunity to impact the business and play a pivotal role in Heap’s success.</p>\n<p>We’re a distributed team that operates within US time zones. The larger Heap engineering team has members in Europe and Australia as well. For this position, we’re looking for remote engineers in time zones that overlap with the contiguous US, including North America and South America.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What we’re building</strong></p>\n<ul class='"ak-ul"'>\n<li>\n<p><strong>Advanced analysis and visualization tools.</strong> Some of the best insights from your data come from places you don’t expect. Working with our Data Science team, we’re building new tools that surface proactive insights from your data and suggest paths for further analysis.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<p><strong>Easier-to-use analysis modules</strong>. Building Heap is as much a design problem as anything else. The most powerful analytics infrastructure in the world doesn't matter if our users can't access that power and understand the results. We’re revamping some of our core analysis modules to provide a better user experience and make it easier for anyone to use Heap to understand user behavior.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<p><strong>Reusable component library and design system</strong>. Working with other frontend-facing product teams, we’re building a reusable component library and design system that can be used across all Heap product teams.</p>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>For this team, you’ll work primarily with Node.js, React, TypeScript, and PostgreSQL. Under the hood, Heap also uses Golang, Scala, Spark, Kafka, and Redis, plus Objective-C, Swift, Java, and Kotlin SDKs. For more about our architecture, check out <a class='"sc-bHwgHz' href="%22https:/heap.io/blog/engineering/virtual-events%22" rel="nofollow">Virtual Events: Making Data-Driven Decisions a Reality</a>.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What we’re looking for</strong></p>\n<ul class='"ak-ul"'>\n<li>\n<p>A collaborative and intellectually curious approach to software development. You enjoy learning from and teaching others, and aren’t afraid of asking lots of questions.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<p>Excellent communication skills, particularly in writing. We’re a distributed team all over the world, so we pride ourselves on our ability to communicate complex ideas clearly in writing across the team.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<p>Experience across the stack with any modern web framework. Familiarity with parts of our stack is a plus (React, Node.js, TypeScript, PostgreSQL).</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<p>Experience with unit, integration, and end-to-end testing.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<p>Experience building and shipping web apps in a cross-functional team, working with design and product. For this role, we’re looking for 3+ years of relevant web development experience.</p>\n</li>\n<li>\n<p>We aren’t expecting you to know everything! One of our core values is “Emphasize Slope Over Y-Intercept,” so we are always looking for candidates eager to learn new technologies.</p>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<hr>\n<p>People are what make Heap awesome. Regardless of age, education, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or any personal characteristics, we want everyone to feel welcome. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive equal opportunity workplace everyone can call home.</p>\n<p>Heap has raised $95M in funding from NEA, Y Combinator, Menlo Ventures, SVAngel, Sam Altman, Garry Tan, Alexis Ohanian, Harj Taggar, Ram Shriram, and others. We partner with small and large businesses to transform how they receive payments from their customers. Our software is used to make the checkout process frictionless - implementing for the first time true one-click purchasing for businesses selling to other businesses.</p>\n<p>Tillit's software helps to increase sales conversion, gets Merchants paid quickly, reliably, and with no credit risk, and frees up cash so they can concentrate on what they do best-providing their customers with world-class goods and services.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Location:</strong></p>\n<p>We are presently building our main talent hubs in Oslo and London with a plan to expand to key European locations over the next 12 months. <strong><em>If you aren't based in either London or Oslo but are keen to explore the role further, we'd love to hear from you</em></strong> — Tillit is a remote-friendly company, with a flexible working policy accommodating onsite and remote teams, with the expectation that travel to our hubs will be required when needed.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong><em>About the role:</em></strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Software Engineers build products that solve some of our customers' core problems. As a Software Engineer, you'll contribute high-quality code to Tillit's suite of products that are mission-critical to eCommerce merchants across Europe, and soon enough around the world</li>\n<li>Tillit's Product Development organization is made up of small teams of Software Engineers. Each team focuses on a specific aspect of a product. For example, you may be part of a team that builds a Tillit front-end application, or a component of the Evergreen API. We encourage movement among teams to share context, skills, and experience, so you'll learn about many different aspects of each product</li>\n<li>Software Engineers are involved throughout the product lifecycle, from idea generation, design, and prototyping to execution, and shipping. As a Software Engineer, you'll collaborate closely with technical and non-technical counterparts to understand our customers' problems and build products that solve them. We think the best way to understand what our users need is to meet them, so occasionally, you'll visit our customers, and come to understand their mission and their pain points</li>\n<li>It doesn’t matter what languages you know when you join us, but it does matter that you can write clean, effective code and learn new languages quickly. Our software is constantly evolving, so we need engineers who can do the same</li>\n<li>Willingness and enthusiasm to do what it takes to get things done, leading by example and getting involved with the team’s day-to-day work</li>\n<li>A focus on impact and an ability to articulate the value your work provides.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong><em>Your day-to-day will involve:</em></strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Building, testing, and releasing product-facing features with stringent correctness and scalability requirements; these features, for example, could be related to KYC, credit decision, settlement, accounting, or security</li>\n<li>Designing a solution with other engineers and the ops team to fix a scalability problem and then implement it</li>\n<li>Contributing to open-source projects</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3"><em><span style="font-size: 12pt;">Technologies We Use</span></em></div>\n<ul>\n<li>Core Tillit products provide the foundations for our deployments.</li>\n<li>Golang for our back-end applications and data integration tools.</li>\n<li>Python for data processing and analysis.</li>\n<li>Tillit cloud infrastructure is based on Google Cloud Platform.</li>\n<li>Typescript, React, Leaflet, and d3 for our web technologies.</li>\n<li>Postgres, Hadoop, and Spark for distributed data storage and parallel computing.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Strong engineering background in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, and Physics or relevant experience</li>\n<li>Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, APIs, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools</li>\n<li>Strong coder with demonstrated proficiency in at least one programming languages, such as Python, Golang, JavaScript, Java, C++, or similar languages</li>\n<li>Ability to collaborate and empathize with a variety of individuals. You can iterate with users and non-technical stakeholders and understand how your technical decisions impact them</li>\n<li>Demonstrated ability to learn and work independently and make decisions with minimal supervision</li>\n<li>A desire to work on software that has an outsized impact, and a passion for creating intuitive, scalable products</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Benefits</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Genuine flexibility in how you work - because you're an adult, and it's what you do that matters, not what hours you work.</li>\n<li>Laptop of choice —The equivalent of a 13" Macbook pro.</li>\n<li>A share options scheme - so that Tillit's success is your success.</li>\n<li>500 Euros Learning and training annual allowance.</li>\n<li>Other accessories: 27" inch monitor, keyboard, mouse for office, and a 50% subsidy towards the purchase of home office equipment.</li>\n</ul>\n NaN

We want to spread great employment rights and benefits and help make them the norm for remote workers across the world.</p><br><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">🗺 Remote working, flexible hours.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">⏱ Permanent, full time</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">💵 Competitive salary</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">🍰 Early stage equity</p><br><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Hiring people internationally is complicated – with interacting engineering, legal, financial, operations, and HR processes. Hiring a team member cross-border should be quick and frictionless, but there are too many barriers to that today.</li><li>HR tools. Companies are more and more building global, distributed teams, and they'll need the tools to enable them to work effectively.</li><li>Integrations. We are integrating payments providers so that employees and contractors all over the world can be paid quickly and conveniently.</li><li>The employee experience. We exist to help remote workers find great jobs.</li></ul><p><font color="#000000"><span style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><br></span></font></p><p class="h3" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Delivering projects to empower companies and remote workers</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">As a lead developer you will <strong>own the technical delivery of significant projects</strong>. </p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">That means understanding product goals and business context and applying that understanding to guiding a small team of developers to successfully implement new features, identifying risks and removing blockers.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">You will play <strong>a key role in our product and delivery process</strong>. You will provide input to requirements and specification, you'll lead discussions on domain model design and implementation planning. And you will shape how developers working on the project work together to implement robust, maintainable code.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">This is a coding role, so you'll be writing code, tests, and debugging issues, and will provide significant development work to the projects. You'll take the lead on applying high standards of code quality and development best practices.</p><br><p class="h3" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Be a key part of our development team</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">We're a young team, you'll help shape our team's process and help us make technical decisions to make us effective and a great place to work as a developer.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">We need you to support developers by answering questions and offering support when needed, or pairing on complex problems. Also we'd like you to be a named mentor for one junior developer.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">And to advance technical excellence at Oyster by researching new tools and practices, taking initiative on technical improvements and refactorings, and moving best practice forward through pairing, discussions in the team.</p><br><p class="h1" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>Experience and skills</strong></p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">We'd like to see:</p><ul style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><li>at least 7 years experience as a software developer</li><li>expert use of Ruby, in addition to use of JavaScript</li><li>experience as tech lead of development teams</li><li>experience as principal or lead developer for large, complex software projects</li></ul><p><font color="#000000"><span style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><br></span></font></p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Skills we're looking for:</p><ul style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><li>software architecture thinking, such as API design, database schema design, services and patterns for robust, secure code</li><li>experience participating in a product process from idea to delivery</li></ul><p><font color="#000000"><span style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><br></span></font></p><p class="h3" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Will this role be a great fit for you?</p><ul style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><li>You thrive working in a team and being supportive of others.</li><li>You're confident about being the most senior developer on your team, and able to set your own high standards about software implementation.</li><li>You're flexible enough to switch between different modes of working, such as programming, technical design, mentoring.</li><li>You take initiative and ownership: moving projects forward.</li></ul><br><p>To see more about this role and about working at Oyster, <a href="https://www.notion.so/oysterhr/Lead-developer-Ruby-Oyster-675ececbd6864d6baa4c82085fafdf66" rel="nofollow"></a><a href="https://www.notion.so/oysterhr/Lead-developer-Ruby-Oyster-675ececbd6864d6baa4c82085fafdf66" rel="nofollow"></a><a href="https://www.notion.so/oysterhr/Lead-developer-Ruby-Oyster-675ececbd6864d6baa4c82085fafdf66" rel="nofollow">click here</a>.</p><br><div class="h1" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>What's it like to work at Oyster ❤️</strong></div><p><span style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Check out our public notion and see for yourself: </span><a href="https://www.notion.so/Welcome-to-Oyster-fc482e3f107c4afd8c85ed217f1d0c1d" rel="nofollow" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Welcome to Oyster!</a><br></p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Here are some pages you might be interested in:</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><a href="https://www.notion.so/Mission-Vision-Values-at-Oyster-3d925cbe892f4e91a755af5fe28fbb02" rel="nofollow">Mission, Vision, Values at Oyster</a></p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><a href="https://www.notion.so/Why-Oyster-is-a-Distributed-Company-6d63e15c1c5f4328aed1e36d6d14f7a7" rel="nofollow">Why Oyster is a Distributed Company</a></p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><a href="https://www.notion.so/How-We-Work-Together-at-Oyster-a01d433b61964b6fa4c11e4cdf8d76c6" rel="nofollow">How We Work Together at Oyster</a></p><br><div class="h2" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Working on the Oyster development team</div><div class="h3" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Our challenge</div><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Automating processes to hire and manage people across 100 countries is hard. Doing so while creating a delightful experience for our users, with robust and maintainable software, and a customizable and flexible platform, is very, very hard. This is the challenge you'll be taking on if you come to work for Oyster.</p><div class="h3" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Team info</div><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>Our team.</strong> We have have a team of about 8 developers, 2 designers, 2 in product. We're growing fast.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>Our technology</strong>. Currently a GraphQL API running in Ruby and Rails, with React and ApolloClient in JavaScript on the frontend. We are running on Heroku.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>Hours.</strong> We have a daily Zoom standup at 12pm GMT. We need developers to normally have significant overlap (say, three to four hours) with the hours of 9am - 6pm GMT, but otherwise your working time is very flexible.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>We use Kanban</strong>, and have a monthly cadence of product investigation, delivery, and time for technical sustainability. (We're on Linear.app.) We have fortnightly retrospectives.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>Team</strong> We have weekly dev team meetings to discuss plans for the platform, where everyone is encouraged to bring topics, and regular brown bag lunch sessions are encouraged for developers to make presentations.</p><p style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>Hackathons and hack days.</strong> We have monthly hack days for developers to work on things they are interested in, and quarterly multi-day Hackathons bringing in people from other parts of the business together with product and development.</p><br><div class="h1" style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><strong>Benefits</strong></div><ul style="caret-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); color: rgb(0, 0, 0);"><li>Flexible hours</li><li>25 days holiday plus public holidays</li><li>Budget of $3,000 for your home office, including a new laptop.</li><li>Access to growing suite of employee benefits</li></ul>\n https://remotive.io/job/547443/logo

138 532443 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/software-dev/senior-web-developer-532443 Senior Web Developer Opticca Consulting Software Development [] contract 2021-03-25T09:44:37 Canada Only <p><strong>Job Description</strong></p>\n<p>We are looking for a dynamic, creative and team-minded full-time software developer to get involved in all aspects of the development lifecycle, including: research, development, design, implementation, testing, documentation, and maintenance. </p>\n<p>As a developer, you have the flexibility and access to work in many facets of software solution. Command &amp; Control systems such as those used for Public Safety are about distributed system components participating in coordinated processing, sharing and notification of emergency related information. Such systems are deployed over secure IP LAN, WAN and mobile networks. The demanding scalability, reliability and performance requirements inherent in those systems impose high-standards on software engineering, network design as well as data storage and retrieval strategies. They also rely on a diversity of technologies such as those used for telephony (VoIP, CTI, PBXs), SIP and WebRTC to enable quality real-time communications between browsers and phone devices, message-oriented middleware, IM/ Presence, web-based technologies and cloud services (REST, Ajax), WebRTC technologies, databases.</p>\n<p><br><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Participate in the design, development, verification and documentation of models, interfaces, components and software applications</li>\n<li>Apply the development processes established by the development team such as the revision of code, follow-up and change management</li>\n<li>Maintain, support and improve all aspects of existing software products</li>\n<li>Participate an agile development process, delivering work in 2-week sprints and successfully collaborating with fellow team members.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Education </strong> <br> • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering or equivalent</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Desired Skills &amp; Experience</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Minimum two (2) years practical experience in the development of Web user interface using React</li>\n<li>Backend development using NodeJs or .NET Core</li>\n<li>Experience with HTML 5, CSS and JavaScript/TypeScript.</li>\n<li>Experience with any of the following would be a plus: C++, C#, .NET, WPF </li>\n<li>Ability to collaborate in with other developers, Support, QA, Tech Writers, Marketing, and Sales in a close-knit team environment</li>\n<li>Comfortable working in Agile process, test-driven development and continuous integration environment.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to learn and apply new ideas quickly.<br> </p>\n NaN

Our passion is building products and services that unlock the true value of connected cars by showing drivers, passengers and organizations the potential hidden within their vehicles' data. We were founded in 2014 and are backed by some of the biggest names in transportation (Cox Auto, Samsung, Continental) venture capital (First Round Capital, Westly Group) and energy (E.ON). We are also partnered with some of the largest players in the mobility industry – including ALD Automotive. And remote work has been a successful part of our cultural DNA since long before 2020. Future members of our team should be intellectually curious, self-starters whose work history demonstrates the courage to create and the maturity required to bring products to market.</p>\n<p><strong>ABOUT THE ROLE</strong></p>\n<p>This position will be responsible for developing the requirements, value propositions, and go-to-market strategies for Vinli's products, to include both connected car telematics platforms and data science applications. You'll serve as the bridge between Vinli business objectives, customer requirements, and design &amp; engineering capabilities.</p>\n<p>The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and strong communicator (written and verbal), and will build the necessary cross-organizational relationships to drive successful projects and campaigns.</p>\n<p><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Write product requirements. We also make all reasonable accommodations to meet our obligations under laws protecting the rights of the disabled.</p>\n<p><strong>Vinli Core Values</strong></p>\n<p>Integrity. We believe that maintaining integrity requires an openness and empathy in sharing goals and challenges with others.</p>\n<p>Drive to Innovate. People at Vinli don't just love to learn, they feel compelled to use their knowledge to make our Company and the world a better place. We believe in learning from our mistakes and always challenging ourselves to innovate - from the biggest product decisions to the smallest processes.</p>\n<p>Joyful Work Environment. Loving where you work isn't about ping pong tables and free snacks. It's the feeling that you wouldn't want to be on a project with any other team. It's the feeling that you can get creative energy just by showing up to work. It's the feeling that your entire team respects your life away from the job and understands how work impacts it. Brightback is a Series A, remote-first enterprise SaaS startup backed by top Silicon Valley VCs and investors. With remote headquarters in SF, our team brings decades of subscription experience from companies like Zendesk, LinkedIn, Twitter, Salesforce, and Heap Analytics.</p>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Job Description</div>\n<p>This is a remote position, we are hiring anywhere in the US.</p>\n<p>In order to realize our mission, we need your help to design and build software and systems that fulfill the needs of Brightback’s customers in this emerging category. We are a high performing team looking for an equally ambitious and driven teammate.</p>\n<p>The right product leader for Zero Hash is intensely customer-focused; collaborates deeply cross-company; and makes decisions with an eye towards our business as a whole. You are extremely technical, bridging business, operations regulatory and development initiatives effortlessly. This role reports directly to the CEO and will be involved in all leadership decisions. If you're looking to have a massive impact in a high-growth startup in one of the most exciting markets in decades, you will find this role challenging and rewarding in equal measure</p>\n<p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Foster a product mindset in every part of the company.</li>\n<li>Own the entire product life cycle, from identifying problems, researching product opportunities, iterating on solutions, building and developing features, and shipping code.</li>\n<li>Work directly with engineers in laying out and designing system architecture to align with product goals. You must be able to hold your own in a room full of deeply technical engineers.</li>\n<li>Create and prioritize our company-wide product roadmap by working with customers and internal stakeholders.</li>\n<li>Develop innovative, industry-leading features and products that uniquely serve Zero Hash's customers - differentiating and winning on ease of integration, design and creativity.</li>\n<li>Interact directly with clients from onboarding and integration, to updating clients of new features and building a cadence of communication to identify any common pain-points.</li>\n<li>Continue to develop the reliability and stability of the platform, by ensuring a robust alerts and monitoring architecture for the product. An understanding around financials services reconciliation tools.</li>\n<li>Experience with digital assets preferred, but not requited.</li>\n<li>Experience with Redis and gRPC.</li>\n<li>Experience with yield-generating products.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Benefits Offered </strong></p>\n<p>We believe that the best way to succeed is by having a happy, motivated and healthy team. We offer the following benefits:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Healthcare Insurance: Zero Hash covers roughly 100% of employee premiums</li>\n<li>Mental health and wellness program</li>\n<li>Equity ownership</li>\n<li>Vision Insurance</li>\n<li>Dental Insurance</li>\n<li>Maternity &amp; Paternity leave</li>\n<li>Visa sponsorship</li>\n<li>401k</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>About Zero Hash </strong></p>\n<p>Zero Hash is backed by Struck Capital, Bain Capital, TradeStation and tastyworks. Zero Hash's mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system 2.0. Zero Hash enables developers and businesses to focus on building experiences and products. We power your favorite brokerage app or neo bank to offer BTC, provide the rails to the 2.0 payment processors, give platforms the ability to facilitate instantaneous cross border payments and eliminate complexity for moving assets for the world's largest liquidity providers.</p>\n<p><strong>The Zero Hash Culture </strong></p>\n<p>All Zero Hash employees are guided by the following characteristics and core principles:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong><em>Independence </em></strong>- an ability to work alone. There is no micromanaging here. Join Seed, pitch ideas and shape the work you do. You will be given responsibility from day one.</li>\n<li><strong><em>Vision</em></strong> - an ability to see the broader picture. We are innovating quickly and challenging the status quo. Seeing where we fit in is critical in making it a reality.</li>\n<li><strong><em>Positivity</em></strong> - a good attitude and respect for others. We're teammates, not co-workers.</li>\n<li><strong><em>Ambition </em></strong>- an ability and a passion for learning and getting things done. We will champion you, challenge you, and push you to achieve your best – and we expect the same in return.</li>\n<li><strong><em>Empathy </em></strong>- an ability to understand the customer. We do not build products for industry, but with industry. Learn our markets and speak to our end-users.</li>\n<li><strong><em>Adaptability</em></strong> - an ability to respond quickly. We are in a fast-paced industry and so we expect you to be creative when solving a new problem and comfortable under pressure.</li>\n</ul>\n NaN

calls, solution presentations, and assist with sizing customer requirements</li>\n<li>Build strong customer relationships and become a trusted advisor</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Required One of the most unique characteristics of our product, Data Science Studio (DSS), is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to technical and non-technical users. Through DSS, we aim to empower people through data and democratize data science.</span></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">As enterprises worldwide become more and more invested in the cloud, Dataiku looks to expand its services and offerings to adapt to rapidly shifting customer needs. We are looking for a talented software engineer to work on the core multi-cloud engines of Dataiku DSS and our new SaaS offering. Dataiku DSS brings together big data and AI technologies into a unique and easy-to-use platform. It allows data scientists to process data with SQL databases, Spark, and Kubernetes with either user-friendly interfaces or code. The platform is technology agnostic and can adapt to any ecosystem. </span></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><strong style="font-size: 12pt;">What we do</strong></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">The mission of the Cloud &amp; Platform teams is to turn Dataiku DSS into a powerful and scalable platform that can run either as a SaaS offering or be deployed by our customers to their AWS, Azure, or GCP infrastructure. This includes reading from and writing data to Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Synapse, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc., and processing data using the latest processing engines and clusters (Spark, Kubernetes, SQL databases, etc.).</span> </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><strong style="font-size: 12pt;">What you will be doing</strong></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><span style="font-size: One of the most unique characteristics of our product, Data Science Studio (DSS), is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to technical and non-technical users. Through DSS, we aim to empower people through data and democratize data science.</span></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">Data visualization is often the most striking (and for some, the most accessible) part of the data-to-insights process. Let’s face it — there’s nothing more exciting than a beautiful fit-for-purpose data viz. We are looking for a talented software engineer to create usable, intuitive, beautiful interfaces and their scalable engines for Dataiku DSS. Dataiku DSS brings together big data and AI technologies into a unique and easy-to-use platform. It allows data scientists to process data with SQL databases, Spark, and Kubernetes with either user-friendly interfaces or code. The same platform also allows business analysts to create powerful machine or deep learning models with just a few clicks. </span></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><strong style="font-size: 12pt;">What we do</strong></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">We design and code experiences that resonate with our growing customer base. We empower non-technical users with user-friendly and well-thought tools to let them quickly and efficiently visualize, analyze, or process their data.</span> <span style="font-size: 12pt;">Our current technical stack is based on Javascript, AngularJS, Angular, and </span><a class="postings-link" href="http://D3.js" rel="nofollow" style="font-size: 12pt;">D3.js</a><span style="font-size: 12pt;"> on the frontend (we only support the latest versions of Chrome and Firefox!). We develop using Java, Spring, and Python on the backend.</span> </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><strong style="font-size: 12pt;">What you will do</strong></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div><span style="font-size: 12pt;">With your top-tier teammates from the engineering team and the help of the UX team, you will:</span></div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>- <span style="font-size: 12pt;">Build the components that allow Dataiku DSS users to create and display charts, dashboards, and ad-</span> <span style="font-size: 12pt;">hoc web applications in a scalable way (both frontend and backend).</span></div>\n<div>- <span style="font-size: 12pt;">Prototype and create new ways to interact with data or integrations with other products such as Tableau, PowerBI, Salesforce, Slack, etc.</span></div>\n<div>- <span style="font-size: 12pt;">Work closely with product managers and UX designers to brainstorm on new features and iteratively refine solutions.</span></div>\n<div>- <span style="font-size: 12pt;">Shape a safe place to work where all ideas and suggestions are welcome and taken into account, and where we all know everyone does their best.</span></div>\n<div>- <span style="font-size: 12pt;">Write high-quality code, as your teammates do!</span></div>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">You are the ideal recruit if:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>You have experience in software development and you are interested in data visualization tools.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You are customer-oriented — you want to understand customer needs and how the product is used.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You are at ease with both frontend and backend development, or you’ve mastered frontend development but are not afraid to dive into backend code to better understand how it works.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You know that a chart is worth a thousand grid cells.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You have firsthand experience (either professional or personal) building a real product.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You blink each time you see a misaligned pixel!</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You are humble and kind. You don't hesitate to ask questions when you don't know, and you treat your colleagues with respect, kindness, and honesty.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Hiring process:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Initial call with the talent acquisition manager</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>On-site meeting (or video call) with a software developer or a team lead</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Home test to show your skills</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Final interviews with an engineering manager and a VP of engineering</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>An informal interview with a Dataiker to understand our culture</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Dataiku’s culture is right for you if</div>\n<ul>\n<li>You want to be able to define your own version of work-life balance - <em>flexible is our go-to word, it applies equally to remote work, vacations and parental benefits </em></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You need autonomy to thrive - <em>we trust our people, give them space to do their best and stay away from artificial deadlines </em></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You enjoy spending time with your colleagues and learning from your peers - <em>meet for Friday universities, annual offsites, virtual trivia nights and more </em></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You like feeling cared about - <em>watch out for the magical Christmas box delivered at home and an unforgettable onboarding week</em></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>You care about giving back -<em> it’s what our </em><a class="postings-link" href="http://Ikig.AI" rel="nofollow"><em>Ikig.AI</em></a><em> program is all about: Dataikers are encouraged to work pro bono for one or several nonprofits of their choosing</em></li>\n</ul>\n<div>To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. Spanning from Sydney to Frankfurt, Denver to London, geography doesn’t stop Dataikers from working closely together and sharing experiences. Collaboration is key within our product and culture. We strive to create a sense of belonging and community while fostering diverse thinking by encouraging cross-team, cross-office interactions like our annual company offsite or Paris onboarding. opportunity:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>The role is also a great fit for candidates who are interested in learning more about modern consumer product startups and the fishing and outdoor industry</li>\n<li>The role presents an opportunity to work on several unique sites with distinct value proposition and unique goals / challenges</li>\n<li>Our tech stack includes a robust data infrastructure and best-in-class personalization tools, including Dynamic Yield</li>\n<li>We place a premium on building a great culture made up of great people</li>\n<li>You will work with and learn from experienced leaders who have a track record of building successful companies</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>What you will do:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Create, execute, and refine testing roadmap to optimize around our site performance and personalization goals. </li>\n<li>Manage day-to-day conversion rate optimization and testing on all our digital properties</li>\n<li>Use Dynamic Yield to build new campaigns, including defining strategy and impacted audience, building testable variants, and implementing the campaigns on site</li>\n<li>Working with engineering and QA teams to build and implement new tests</li>\n<li>Identify improvements that can be made to our event tracking, A/B testing methodology, and data analysis to inform further optimization and improvements</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>What you’ll need:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>1-2 years of on-site ecommerce optimization experience, preferably for consumer products</li>\n<li>Understanding of modern web architecture and capabilities of HTLM, CSS, and Javascript (front-end coding experience not required)</li>\n<li>Working knowledge of statistics to accurately set up experiments and interpret testing performance</li>\n<li>Experience using VWO, Optimizely, Google Optimize, or similar A/B testing tools</li>\n<li>(Preferable) Experience using Dynamic Yield or a similar personalization platform</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>What will make you successful:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Self-starter / Motivated</li>\n<li>Collaborative – able to work with stakeholders to get things Co?</strong></p>\n<p>At Catch Co, our purpose is to rescue people from the indoors by connecting them with America’s top outdoor sport: fishing. More than 50 million Americans fish every year and Catch Co is the industry leader in creating products, content, and experiences that modern anglers love. Most importantly, we aim to be the industry’s most data-driven and customer-centric company.</p>\n<p>We are building 3 unique businesses to deliver on that mission:</p>\n<ol>\n<li><a href="%22https:/mysterytacklebox.com/%22" rel="nofollow"><strong>Mystery Tackle Box</strong></a> - Founded in 2012, MTB is the most popular fishing subscription service in the world, with over 5 million boxes shipped (and counting!).</li>\n<li><a href="%22https:/shopkarls.com/%22" rel="nofollow"><strong>Karl’s Bait and Tackle</strong></a> - Launched in 2018, Karl’s is a unique and exciting ecommerce experience that brings the local tackle shop to the Internet.</li>\n<li><a href="%22https:/catchco.com/%22" rel="nofollow"><strong>Catch Co. fishing products</strong></a> - Catch Co also designs and develops some of fishing’s most popular and innovative brands and products, sold online and in retail throughout the world.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>To support these businesses, we have built a best-in-class foundation of creativity, technology, data, and a fun and supportive culture. We have also built durable partnerships with some of the industry’s most impactful content creators, influencers, product designers, and more. </p>\n<p>As we execute against our mission, our team members remain curious, action-oriented, and collaborative. If that sounds like you, we would love to meet you.</p>\n<p><strong>Everybody can fish with us! </strong></p>\n<p>These are our core values:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Passion:</strong> We love what we do and we take pride in our work.</li>\n<li><strong>Action:</strong> We work hard to get stuff done, with urgency.</li>\n<li><strong>Optimism:</strong> We believe that we will succeed, and we are willing to keep trying new things.</li>\n<li><strong>Honesty: </strong>We tell it like it is, communicate issues, take accountability and use data to make decisions. We are transparent with customers, partners and employees.</li>\n<li><strong>Curiosity:</strong> We look for ways to make things better. We focus on solutions, not problems.</li>\n<li><strong>#happydance:</strong> We create happiness for our customers and for each other.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Our culture is fast-moving, hardworking, welcoming and friendly, and we keep our calendar full of opportunities to learn from coworkers and foster community. In today's world of digital and physical transactions, your privacy is at risk. There is a thin line between use and abuse, making this one of the largest business issues in the world today. And LEAP Enterprises is on a mission to solve it.</p>\n<p>LEAP explores the technology and biology of privacy and trust, combining user experience, machine learning, psychology and more to provide the best solutions in the business of privacy. </p>\n<p>Our approach protects and empowers the individual while reducing the fear associated with how information is used and shared by today's largest global companies. There is an imperative in the business community today to quickly and reliably know that “you are who you say you are” while protecting the data you share with them.</p>\n<p>We wish we could tell you more details about our solution, but our job is to keep our work out of the wrong hands. We're looking for people who are collaborative, purpose-driven and creative. But more than that, we need people on our team who believe in the mission to safeguard privacy amidst 21st century interactions. We look forward to engaging with you on what we can accomplish together!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>ROLE OVERVIEW:</strong></p>\n<p>Looking for a strategic and dynamic Senior Pre/Post Sales/Solutions Engineer to help us deliver our best in class identity proofing and fraud prevention solutions to the world. Accurately proving "who" someone is in retail as well as digital environments is crucial for today's businesses. As a Senior Sales/Solutions Engineer you will be tasked with translating complex business needs, identity problems and fraud issues into practical, technical design solutions.</p>\n<p>As we scale, you'll contribute to making our company ever more enterprise-ready. Bridging the business problem/design solution gap for enterprise customers, you'll support the design and integration of our companies API / SDKs. Working collaboratively with cross-functional internal teams you'll help develop demos, manage POC's/ trials, lead industry specific presentations. support RFPs, and help successfully on-board customers post sales.</p>\n<p>Day to day you'll partner with our Sales and Customer Success teams on prospective client meetings / calls, applying your technical knowledge to the discovery of customer workflows, platforms and needs. From this you'll offer smart solutions to customer pain points, drawing on our unique suite of offerings. Interacting confidently with C-suite clients and prospects from the fastest growing fintechs to fortune 500 / FTSE 100 companies, you'll position our company as the leading provider in fraud prevention.</p>\n<p>Our company is in hyper-growth mode. Buckle up and get ready for an amazing opportunity and challenge.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Your Outcomes this year: </strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Able to effectively and independently deliver a product demonstration including strategic messaging around our value to customers. </li>\n<li>Own the ‘white glove' evaluation preparation, implementation and follow up for complex evaluations and POCs. and business models through your knowledge transfer to customers as their SME. </li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>As a Senior Pre/Post Sales/Solution Engineer you will be:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Bridging the gap between selling our company's services and helping customers through trial and integration of our solution</li>\n<li>Proactively supporting customer with design and integration of our API/SDKs</li>\n<li>Project managing POC's/trials, the customer integration progress, together with account management</li>\n<li>Assisting with / aiding in development of demos, trials &amp; industry-specific presentations</li>\n<li>Helping the Sales team suss out new use cases where our solutions can add value to customers</li>\n<li>Supporting RFPs and creating workflows to ensure RFPs are documented and optimized between Sales and Engineering teams</li>\n<li>Working closely with product, engineering and operations team on new products as well as documenting customer feedback on existing solutions</li>\n<li>Requirements of Senior Solution Engineer will have a combination of:</li>\n<li>Proven enterprise pre and post sales engineering specialist</li>\n<li>Knowledge of Identity &amp; Access Management (IAM), Customer Identity &amp; Access Management (CIAM) and/or digital identity verification (IDV) is Ideally Python, Ruby, Javascript, Swift/Objective-C, Java</li>\n<li>Clear understanding of RESTful API design and integration patterns</li>\n<li>Ability to help developers successfully integrate with our companies platform</li>\n<li>Understanding of security principles and data protection regulation</li>\n<li>Experience of working cross functionally with Sales, Account Management, Customer target markets - FS, fintech, GIG economy, recruitment</li>\n<li>Thrives in a company wearing multiple hats (you might be tasked to help/lead other projects and initiatives)</li>\n<li>Ability to provide formal and semi formal written materials ranging from contract language to performance reports</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Desirable Skills:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Has worked in a startup with a scaling sales team</li>\n<li>Ability to put together reports for post evaluation customer review</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Bachelor skills</li>\n<li>You are a "rock star" with a proactive, yet positive attitude</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>PERSONAL:</strong></p>\n<p>Excellent problem solving skills and exceptional attention Web apps are Angular/Typescript. Mobile apps are native using Swift and Java+Kotlin.</li>\n<li>Gitlab for source control (git) and continuous integration</li>\n<li>The team follows a lightweight Kanban process.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h2"> </div>\n<div class="h2">What we value</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Collaboration — Hard problems are solved by teams, and we value working together.</li>\n<li>Learning — Innovation starts with learning. We love to expand our knowledge and question things we think we understand well.</li>\n<li>Quality — Automated tests are the norm, and we long for continuous deployment.</li>\n<li>Security — Health data privacy and integrity are critical. We're serious about security.</li>\n<li>Diversity — Different ideas and backgrounds help generate better solutions… and are more fun.</li>\n<li>Modern frameworks and sharp tools — Time is valuable. Let's not waste it on bad technology.</li>\n<li>Work/life balance — Work isn't everything. We strive to be effective and efficient, and also respect our personal lives.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h2"> </div>\n<div class="h2">Benefits</div>\n<p>This is a full-time position that includes a competitive salary, flexible remote work policy, health insurance, equity, retirement plan, paid holidays, discretionary time off and other benefits. Our headquarters are in Durham, NC, one of the highest ranked cities in the country for growth, entrepreneurship, affordability, smarts, dining and entertainment. </p>\n<p>To learn more, please email us at careers @ pattern.health.</p>\n<p> </p>\n NaN

As featured in The Economist, Wired, and The New York Times, GA offers training in web development, data, design, business, and more, both online and at campuses around the world. Our global professional community boasts 40,000 full- and part-time alumni — and counting.</p>\n<p>In addition to fostering career growth for individuals, GA helps employers cultivate top tech talent and spur innovation by transforming their teams through strategic learning. More than 21,000 employees at elite companies worldwide have honed their digital fluency with our corporate training programs. GA has also been recognized as one of Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500, and Fast Company has dubbed us leaders in World-Changing Ideas as well as the #1 Most Innovative Company in Education.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>We are looking for instructors:</strong></p>\n<p>Our Software Engineering Flex Immersive is a life-changing part-time educational experience where our students learn the skills and mindsets to take on new careers as web developers. We are looking for a lead instructor with strong JavaScript experience to play a key role on our growing instructional team.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Why teach our Software Engineering Flex Immersive?</strong></p>\n<p>If you are looking to make a life-changing impact by sharing your love for software development with the next generation of developers, we’d love for you to consider joining our team. We deliver more than just skills training, and are looking for teachers who share our vision for a community of lifelong learners pursuing work that they love. As a full-time teacher for our flagship full-time web development program, you will join us on one of our many campuses to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Work closely with one or more co-instructors to guide students through a rigorous, transformational journey towards apprenticeship in software development.</li>\n<li>Become a better leader, and mentor as you learn from veteran instructors and our world-class instructional coaches.</li>\n<li>Inspire and support students as they identify their passions and drive their own continued learning beyond the curriculum.</li>\n<li>Adapt our global curriculum and use it to guide your teaching, building your own lesson plans as needed and contributing back your lessons learned over time.</li>\n<li>Facilitate a safe, supportive, and energetic community that welcomes the various needs and learning styles of your students.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What do we teach?</strong></p>\n<p>We adapt both our global curriculum and local approach to the technical trends and hiring environment of the times and cities we work in, but today our primary educational approach centers around JavaScript. In general, our curriculum is scaffolded to follow the historical evolution of software engineering. We start by teaching the fundamentals of programming and web design through JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. About 25% of our course (normally unit 2 of 4) focuses on Rails MVC or similar framework, using that context to introduce databases, security, and other foundational knowledge. The rest of the course (units 3 and 4) focuses back on JavaScript and introduces Python. We cover API development in Node, then tackle one or more front-end MV* frameworks (React). We also cover all sorts of other things that junior web developers need to know, like source control, team collaboration, and developer workflow.</p>\n<p>We give students the chance to spend focused time building at least 4 major projects, in addition to other smaller projects and labs. About 20% of overall class time is spent on dedicated project work.</p>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3"><strong>Skills and Qualifications</strong></div>\n<ul>\n<li>You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out.</li>\n<li>You are eager to shape the skills, minds, and careers of the newest generation of web developers.</li>\n<li>You have at least 2+ years of experience working on a software development team.</li>\n<li>Familiarity with Computer Science topics, such as: Recursion, Sorting, Search, Linked Lists, Stacks and queues, Sets, Trees, Search Tries, Graphs, Hash tables, and Design patterns</li>\n<li>You have working experience in both front-end and back-end development, and are fluent in</li>\n<ul>\n<li>HTML and CSS</li>\n<li>Full-stack JavaScript (strong JavaScript highly preferred)</li>\n<li>At least one JS MV* framework (React preferred)</li>\n<li>SQL databases (we generally use PosgreSQL)</li>\n<li>NoSQL (we generally cover MongoDB and Redis)</li>\n<li>At least one additional object-oriented language (Python preferred)</li>\n</ul>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Lead one of two evening classes (3 hours) per week and every other Saturday (10am-6pm), for the 24 week duration of the programme.</li>\n<li>Instructors will need to commit a few hours per week preparing lessons and materials, leveraging existing GA curriculum content.</li>\n<li>Work closely with co-instructors or teaching assistants to provide students with meaningful and prompt feedback on their progress.</li>\n<li>Work alongside GA staff and teaching team to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students.</li>\n<li>Guide students through development of a stellar final project that will showcase their abilities to hiring managers.</li>\n<li>Facilitate a dynamic, collaborative, and positive classroom community.</li>\n<li>Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of learning a new skill set</li>\n</ul>\n</section>\n<section class='"more-details"'>\n<section Our method is empowering, holistic, and a fraction of the cost of traditional treatment.</p>\n<p>Our empathetic approach to our members mirrors how we work together as a team. While you absolutely do not have to be sober to work at Tempest, several us are, and we honor that by celebrating soberversarys and through an entirely sober social calendar.</p>\n<p><em>Tempest provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.</em></p>\n<p><em>This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.</em></p>\n NaN

Learn more at <a href="https://get.vitalsource.com/" rel="nofollow">https://get.vitalsource.com</a> and follow us on <a href="https://twitter.com/vitalsource" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/vitalsource-technologies" rel="nofollow">LinkedIn</a>, and <a href="http://instagram.com/vitalsource" rel="nofollow">Instagram</a>.</p>\n<p>The world is reading and <strong>Ingram Content Group</strong> (“Ingram”) connects people with content in all forms. Ingram Content Group is a part of Ingram Industries Inc. and includes Ingram Book Group LLC, Ingram Publisher Services LLC, Lightning Source LLC, VitalSource Technologies LLC, Ingram Library Services LLC, and Tennessee Book Company LLC.</p>\n<p><em>Ingram Content Group LLC is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, work related mental or physical disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information.</em></p>\n<p><em> EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled</em></p>\n<p><em>We participate in EVerify.</em></p>\n<p><a href="http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf" rel="nofollow"><em>EEO Poster in English</em></a><em> </em><br><a href="http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeosp.pdf" rel="nofollow"><em>EEO Poster in Spanish</em></a><em> </em></p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n NaN

The company processes billions in payments per year, connecting all the entities involved to make those transactions faster, more secure, less expensive, and more transparent. Clients in business, education and healthcare use our partner’s full-service platform to tailor the payment experience for their customers and to create a single point of visibility and control for payer engagement and receivables management – from invoicing and payment through reconciliation. Our partner also supports its clients with end-to-end customer support including multilingual servicing via phone, email, and chat, as well as around-the-clock online payment tracking.</p>\n<p>The company is headquartered in Boston and has offices in Chicago, London and Manchester, Valencia, Shanghai, Singapore, Tokyo, Cluj, and Sydney.</p>\n<p>Our partner is looking for an experienced engineer to join the Site Reliability Engineering Team to help drive reliability, automation and performance in our cloud-based infrastructure.</p>\n<p>Their SRE team is responsible for the lifecycle of production systems, working across multiple levels. SRE’s are embedded in the development teams enabling and empowering them to achieve full speed on shipping reliable and operable systems. They also work at a global scale driving initiatives to achieve production excellence.</p>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Key responsibilities:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Design, build and maintain core infrastructure pieces with a focus on availability, latency, performance, and capacity.</li>\n<li>Be embedded on a development team helping them navigate production excellence and advocate for best practices.</li>\n<li>Engage and collaborate with other disciplines in the design, deployment, operation, and optimization of services.</li>\n<li>Debug production issues across services and levels of the stack and practice incident response and blameless postmortem.</li>\n<li>Be part of an on-call shift along with other disciplines to respond to incidents.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">What’s next in our team?</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Pushing SRE practice to the next level</li>\n<li>Help development teams to migrate production systems to our new platform</li>\n<li>Migration of the data layer to managed services</li>\n<li>Keep pursuing full DevSecOps</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Organisational Culture:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>They are a global company, their engineering team is distributed across 3 continents and 4 different countries, they like working remotely.</li>\n<li>Our engineering practise is shaped around some of the concepts of Agile, Lean, and Extreme Programming. Each team has a high level of autonomy to organize themselves in the way they consider more appropriate to execute their mission.</li>\n<li>They actively engage in knowledge sharing by hosting internal cross-discipline events</li>\n<li>They are active in contributing to open source whenever possible</li>\n<li>They contribute to our local communities by hosting different events, meetups, etc...</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">The Hiring Process :</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Our client is excited to get to know you!</li>\n<li>Throughout their process, you can expect 4-5 rounds of interviews with different team members including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a homework assignment (it is not that bad!).</li>\n<li>Your TA Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements</strong></p>\n<p>Our client is aiming to build a multidisciplinary and balanced team based on "t-shaped" individuals. As such we are looking for people comfortable with the idea of being or becoming a generalizing specialist.</p>\n<p>Software engineering is an essential part of their work, they actively use and support many different platforms and languages. Experience with at least one programming language is needed, also experience with testing techniques such as TDD or BDD will be highly valued.</p>\n<p>Being familiar with the container ecosystem, cloud infrastructure, build systems and CI/CD tools is critical for being successful at this role. You will need to be comfortable taking ownership of complex systems challenges and help uncover opportunities for improvement.</p>\n<p>In the SRE team, they have enablers, they empower and encourage their fellow colleagues so you will need to have strong communication and collaboration skills, and most importantly, empathy.</p>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Some Technologies We Use :</div>\n<p>These are some of the technologies that we use, but we are always learning, experimenting and open to change:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Ruby, Java, Kotlin, Go, Node, Python</li>\n<li>AWS: EC2, ECS, Lambda, Cloudwatch, SQS, RDS, Kinesis, S3, ElasticSearch, DocumentDB</li>\n<li>Linux, Docker, Terraform, Make, Chef</li>\n<li>Gitlab, Jenkins</li>\n<li>Sentry, Sumologic, New Relic</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Benefits</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Competitive compensation, including stock options</li>\n<li>Work with experienced people that will keep you on your toes</li>\n<li>Professional training to be successful in your role, books, online courses and conferences and also physical conferences once the world opens up</li>\n<li>Professional &amp; Personal growth opportunities</li>\n<li>Competitive time off and FlyBetter Days to support any cause you believe in</li>\n<li>Wellbeing Programs</li>\n</ul>\n<p><em>The company is an equal opportunity employer. software</li>\n<li>Guide the selection of engineers for Delivery teams</li>\n<li>Help ensure engineering teams are set up for success on projects</li>\n<li>Provide proactive support to engineering high-level coaching cannot resolve satisfactorily</li>\n<li>Facilitate (and complete as necessary) engineering estimations (velocity-based) in collaboration with Head of Delivery to support the sales unidirectional data flow patterns (Redux, etc.)</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience with RxJS or other Reactive programming techniques/libraries</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience using ES2015 (ES6) and Final conversation (we would like to hire you):</strong> We are going to chat about any concerns you might have, on-boarding as well as any other details to get you started.
