Does the challenge of building platforms and abstractions for the on-demand "skills economy" excite you? Wyndy is looking for talented JavaScript engineers to help us build and scale multiple marketplace platforms and products - including our original mobile app, <a href="https://www.wyndy.com/" rel="nofollow">Wyndy</a>, and our new Eve marketplace platform, which is currently powering the <a href="https://www.getalysyn.com/" rel="nofollow">Alysyn</a> brand. This is no small undertaking, and you'll need to be up to the challenge of creating interfaces and abstractions that power brand-agnostic, multi-tenant architectures across the web and mobile while interfacing with a variety of third-party systems and APIs.</p>\n<div class="h1"> </div>\n<div class="h1">About Us</div>\n<p>Wyndy began as a mobile app that makes it simple for parents to find, book, and pay vetted, background-checked college babysitters. We're now in over 20 markets and looking to go deeper in our existing markets and expand to more markets across the U.S. But we've always known that our technology and approach could serve a variety of industries. We've now expanded our product line to include Alysyn, an on-demand marketplace connecting dental practices to dental professionals for short-term work. We're looking for team members to help us scale Wyndy and Alysyn as well as identify additional opportunities in the "skills economy".</p>\n<div class="h1"> </div>\n<div class="h1">Who You Are</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Experienced - You have at least 5 years of software engineering experience, with at least 3 years of React experience.</li>\n<li>User-focused - As a front-end engineer, your work is front and center in our customers mind and is the first touch point for many of them. While you may or may not be a designer, you've got a sharp eye for design and, in particular, for understanding how to build intuitive, accessible experiences.</li>\n<li>Collaborative - You'll need to be comfortable working with team members from all facets of the business - from engineering and product to marketing and customer success - to continuously deliver value.</li>\n<li>Agile - We're big believers in the principles laid out in the <a href="https://agilemanifesto.org/" rel="nofollow">Manifesto for Agile Software Development</a> and use Scrum as a framework for delivering consistent, iterative results.</li>\n<li>Platform-minded - you can approach problems with a "platform mindset" and are comfortable working with concepts such as white-labelling, multi-tenancy, feature flagging, and multi-sided marketplaces.</li>\n<li>Quality-oriented - You have a strong understanding of and experience applying a variety of software design patterns to write organized, dynamic code that clearly communicates intent to other collaborators.</li>\n<li>Iterative - You understand that your first effort is not always your best effort. You regularly revisit features, bugfixes, technical debt, and performance bottlenecks to find opportunities to optimize and improve the platform.</li>\n<li>Communicative - As a remote-first organization, we believe that communication is of utmost importance to our success. Whether writing a bug report or presenting a new feature, you should be able to communicate your ideas in a clear, concise fashion.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h1"> </div>\n<div class="h1">What You'll Do</div>\n<p>Reporting to the Head of Engineering, you'll be responsible for delivering features, bugfixes, and improvements across the platform stack.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Collaborate - You'll collaborate with team members to help identify, research, and prioritize areas of improvement across the platform.</li>\n<li>Commit - After working with the team to establish priorities, you'll commit to the work to be done and hold yourself accountable to those commitments.</li>\n<li>Deliver - You'll regularly ship value by way of features, bugfixes, and other improvments; share your results with the team; and surface any blockers and/or wins along the way.</li>\n<li>Understand - As you deliver value, you'll seek feedback from team members in a variety of methods including code review, automated and manual QA, and sprint reviews to name a few.</li>\n<li>Assess - Using feedback from the team and our customers, you'll help to assess ways to improve our products as well as our processes moving forward.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h1"> </div>\n<div class="h1">Tools We Use</div>\n<p>While we've relied on quite a few frameworks, libraries, and APIs to get ourselves to this point, we're always exploring new ideas, strategies, and patterns to improve. That being said, we're looking for someone that is excited and capable to "hit the ground running" with our current stack:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>React - We use React for much of our web front-end, as well as React Native for mobile. You should have a strong understanding of React concepts and be be able to build out intuitive user interfaces with it. Furthermore, you should be comfortable with advanced concepts such as custom hooks, routing, and portals.</li>\n<li>GraphQL - While REST is great we believe GraphQL is the future of web APIs and have adopted it across our stack. You'll need to be comfortable developing and working with complex schemas, as well as utilizing tools such as Apollo to handle concerns such as pagination, caching, and refetching data.</li>\n<li>Webpack - We tend to favor a "component-driven" approach to front-end development over the single page approach popularized in recent years. As such, you'll need to be comfortable working with advanced webpack configuration to keep builds small while working with a library of custom, home-grown components.</li>\n<li>Ruby on Rails - You'll need to be incredibly comfortable working with complex Ruby on Rails codebases.</li>\n<li>Stripe - We've processed millions of dollars in transactions on our platforms - you'll need to be experienced working with how to securely implement payment processing APIs and keep customer data safe.</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h1"> </div>\n<div class="h1">Perks &amp; Benefits</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Competitive salary + stock options</li>\n<li>Comprehensive benefits (health, dental, vision)</li>\n<li>Flexible paid time off / vacation</li>\n<li>Paid Maternity Leave</li>\n<li>Wyndy is an “office-optional” employer, meaning we welcome remote applicants from across the United States.</li>\n</ul>\n NaN

We believe that money is a form of technology that can be innovated on. As a pioneer in monetary technology, we build open infrastructure, rethink monetary policy, and create revolutionary applications that sets the stage for open financial platforms.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Some examples include:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Mirror : Mirror is a synthetic asset protocol built on top of the Terra blockchain. These 'mirrored asset' (mAssets) are tokens that track the price of the underlying real life asset, such as stocks, ETFs, commodities etc. The vision of mirror is to allow unfettered access to global markets. By utilizing Terra's stable coins, liquidity for the Mirror Protocol is greatly improved, and the decentralized nature of the protocol allows for immediate access from anywhere in the world. Mirror investors are able to freely access the protocol by both web and mobile application. With Mirror, users are able to join in the value-creation process seen in real financial markets.</li>\n<li>Anchor : Anchor is a savings protocol that provides stablecoin depositors with a stable interest rate that is much more competitive to traditional savings products.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>As featured in:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Bloomberg</strong>: "<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-26/novogratz-invests-in-crypto-startup-serving-millions-in-korea" rel="nofollow">Novogratz Invests in Crypto Startup Serving Millions in Korea</a>"</li>\n<li><strong>Coindesk</strong>: "<a href="https://www.coindesk.com/galaxy-coinbase-bet-25m-on-defi-using-terra-stablecoins" rel="nofollow">Galaxy, Coinbase Bet $25M on DeFi Using Terra Stablecoins</a>"</li>\n<li><strong>NASDAQ</strong>: "<a href="https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/terra-brings-24-hour-trading-to-synthetic-versions-of-stocks-like-tsla-and-aapl-2020-12-03" rel="nofollow">Terra Brings 24-Hour Trading to Synthetic Versions of Stocks Like TSLA and AAPL</a>"</li>\n<li><strong>Yahoo! We have recently begun the transition to websites being built in React, housed in a modern, headless CMS (Sanity.io). Over a period of years we will be slowly redesigning and replacing old websites (built on Wordpress) with completely new and improved versions built on this new stack.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Why you'll love it:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>You will be empowered to do what you do best - build fantastic, performant, creative and accessible websites using modern technology and techniques</li>\n<li>You'll work with a talented, friendly and passionate team of Developers, UX Designers, Art Directors and SEO specialists</li>\n<li>Motivated by quality - you will be encouraged to make every deliverable the best it could be, whilst keeping to time and budget - you understand the need to balance excellence with time </li>\n<li>You will be joining a unique group of companies that are all leaders in their field and shaping the future of work</li>\n<li>You'll have a strong voice in the future plans for our websites and be a good influencer to support innovation for implementation </li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Essential skills:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>HTML (Semantic)</li>\n<li>Javascript (preferably familiar with ES6)</li>\n<li>CSS and SASS</li>\n<li>GIT Version Control</li>\n<li>Some experience with Content Management Systems - we use Wordpress and Sanity.io</li>\n<li>Good knowledge of current trends, techniques and best practices</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Desirable skills:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>React</li>\n<li>GraphQL</li>\n<li>Redux</li>\n<li>Sanity.io</li>\n<li>Webpack</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Example tasks completed in a month:</strong></p>\n<p>In a given month, you might be working on one of our big projects (such as developing a new website for one of our brands), as well as maintaining or adding features to our existing websites. You'll review wireframes or art direction for upcoming websites to give your technical feedback. It's important that we keep up to date with best practice and will be sure to also allocate time for personal upskilling and knowledge sharing across the team.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About you:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>You're an expert front-end developer with experience in the above technologies, and enthusiasm to work for a variety of exciting brands</li>\n<li>You have an impressive portfolio demonstrating your experience in commercial front-end development</li>\n<li>You are a strong communicator and understand the importance of rationalising the ‘why', ‘when' and ‘how' to a range of people with a variety of technical understanding </li>\n<li>People enjoy working with you - a strong team player, you are able to view all tasks and challenges from a range of angles</li>\n<li>You are keen on time management and can project manage your priorities as agreed within a team</li>\n<li>Passionate about accessibility </li>\n<li>Passionate about website performance</li>\n</ul>\n<p><br><strong>What we offer:</strong></p>\n<p>At LTG we offer a competitive salary and benefits package including a healthcare cash plan, life assurance, pension contributions, a ShareSave scheme, flexible working, a discretionary bonus scheme and travel loans along with access to Perkbox for individually tailored benefits and offers. All that and great bean-to-cup coffee and fresh fruit in our UK offices.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About the company:</strong></p>\n<p>Learning Technologies Group is a leader in the high-growth workplace learning and talent industry. The Group offers end-to-end learning and talent management solutions ranging from strategic consultancy, through a range of content and platform solutions to analytical insights that enable corporate and government clients to meet their performance objectives.</p>\n<p>LTG is listed on the London Stock Exchange Alternative Investment Market (LTG.L) and headquartered in London. The Group has offices in Europe, the United States, Asia-Pacific and South America.</p>\n<p>LTG's businesses – LEO Learning, Gomo, Eukleia, PRELOADED, Rustici Software, PeopleFluent, Watershed and Affirmity – are at the forefront of innovation and best-practice in the learning technology sector, and have received numerous awards for their exceptional performance. Our portfolio of brands represents the best of breed and they are acknowledged throughout the industry as market leaders.</p>\n<p>For more information, visit ltgplc.com.</p>\n<p>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.</p>\n<p> </p>\n NaN

Individually, you will contribute to designing and building the infrastructure to support our business. As a team lead, you'll function as an architect and you'll guide the technical decision making process for the entire infrastructure team. We're not the biggest data solutions provider yet, but reliability and security are critical to our business and crucial to its continued growth. So, if you're up to the challenge, come join our team and help us deliver a high quality, reliable experience for both clients and developers.</p>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Responsibilities:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Design, build, and maintain the core infrastructure used by Demyst's engineering teams</li>\n<li>Work collaboratively to scope functional and technical requirements for new and potential projects and features</li>\n<li>Lead a small but growing infrastructure/DevOps team</li>\n<li>Debug production issues across services and levels of the stack</li>\n<li>Plan for the growth of Demyst’s infrastructure</li>\n<li>Build a stellar customer experience for internal and external end users</li>\n<li>Strong focus on creating self-service tools to augment the abilities of others</li>\n<li>Lead architectural improvements in our software development and delivery infrastructure and evaluate new technologies</li>\n<li>Collaborate with product and project teams to understand needs and enable them with infrastructure</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Strong understanding of and experience with AWS services</li>\n<li>Experience with Immutable Infrastructure and Infrastructure-as-Code (Cloudformation on AWS)</li>\n<li>Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment</li>\n<li>Proficient in more than one language (more is better) Python, Javascript, Bash, strong JSON + YAML experience. others.</li>\n<li>Skill in delivering human-centered design solutions.</li>\n<li>High attention to detail.</li>\n<li>Strong sense of responsibility and willingness to take ownership of Think pharmaceutical manufacturers, wind farms, and energy companies with tons of equipment and sensors. Our software engineers tackle hard problems in streaming calculation, storage, distributed computing, and UX design, leveraging the latest in frontend technologies.</p>\n<p>Our company was founded 100% remote and <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/stay-at-home-team-mark-derbecker/" rel="nofollow" title="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/stay-at-home-team-mark-derbecker/">we're proud of it</a>. We were good at remote long before COVID and will continue to be remote when COVID is a memory. You can work anywhere in a compatible time zone (our core hours are 8am-12pm Pacific). We use a variety of collaboration tools, like Zoom, Slack, and our homegrown <a href="https://qube.work/" rel="nofollow" title="https://qube.work/">Qube Virtual Office</a>, which make us feel like we're in the same building together. We use agile tenets to iterate on both our product and development processes. We have a <a href="https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Seeq-Reviews-E898633.htm" rel="nofollow">wonderful team</a> of kind-hearted, talented engineers that love to collaborate, teach each other new tricks, and build products that exceed our customers’ expectations.</p>\n<p>Our frontend technology stack is React/TypeScript/JavaScript with some legacy AngularJS. The core of our product is a full-featured calculation engine that can perform complex math and execute machine learning algorithms on streaming time series data.</p>\n<div class="h1"> </div>\n<div class="h1">SKILLS &amp; REQUIREMENTS</div>\n<p>You love computers and programming. You’ve done projects that you’re very proud of. You have (or will soon have) a degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent experience.</p>\n<p>You want to learn to work with databases (Postgres) and cloud platforms (EC2, Azure, GCE). You're interested in finding the best tool to solve a problem without getting caught up in whether it's the new hip thing.</p>\n<p>You’re disciplined with a high attention to detail. You learn things quickly.</p>\n<p>You listen really well, and you know how to make your ideas be heard without turning people off.</p>\n<p>You are up for traveling periodically to hang out with your colleagues and get some face-to-face time.</p>\n<p>You know how to balance life &amp; work, and you don’t want a job that forces you to choose between them.</p>\n<p>You want to work with a bunch of really smart people that love working together. And you want to work at a startup with lots of happy customers, good investors, and a bright future.</p>\n<p>You’ve read this far and are determined to apply directly through seeq.com/careers and not through a third-party hiring site.</p>\n<p>You will answer the following question in your application cover letter: “What makes Seeq a good fit for you?”</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><span style="font-size: 18px;">ABOUT SEEQ</span></p>\n<p>Seeq is a remote-first (only) company founded by serial entrepreneurs. Our executive team and board of directors have extensive experience with successful startup ventures in high-growth environments. </p>\n<p>We are founded on the idea that companies need better solutions for quickly and easily getting business insight from their industrial process data. Our mission is to provide software and services that convert that data into meaningful information that the business can use to improve profitability.</p>\n<p>We use the best modern big data technologies to bring industrial process data into the business decision process.</p>\n<p>Our company is virtual, meaning that everyone works from a location of their choosing. There’s no commute and no cubicle! We are serious about recruiting and retaining the best teammates. We think there are tons of benefits to working on exciting technology with a cohesive team and the flexibility to work from anywhere. Here are a few more benefits we have to offer:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Salary plus equity incentives</li>\n<li>Medical benefits, plus optional Flexible Spending Account and Health Savings Account programs to cover additional medical expenses</li>\n<li>Optional life, disability, and personal accident insurance</li>\n<li>Employee Assistance Program</li>\n<li>Adoption assistance</li>\n<li>Internet and mobile phone stipend</li>\n<li>Untracked/unlimited time off</li>\n<li>Company meetup events in destination locations</li>\n<li>Knowledgeable and supportive co-workers</li>\n</ul>\n NaN

Check them out <a href="https://sites.google.com/publitas.com/habits-values/values?authuser=0" rel="nofollow">here</a>!</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What you’ll do</strong></p>\n<p>As a Full-Stack Developer, you will develop a web software product; deliver features end-to-end; maintain and improve the performance, stability, and scalability of our stack; contribute to our development, product, and design strategy; deliver features end-to-end; help other engineers to grow their skill sets; and design and implement backend and frontend architecture. </p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<p><strong>Who you’ll work with</strong></p>\n<p>You will join<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/italoj/" rel="nofollow"> Italo</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/alejandro-mansor-68799215b/" rel="nofollow">Ale</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/martinianofelici/" rel="nofollow">Martin</a> and <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/matthew-sealey-13566b109/" rel="nofollow">Matthew</a> in our Development team, where everyone works together and contributes to the success of our product. <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/felix-hageloh-1965025/" rel="nofollow">Felix</a>, our Tech Lead, will be the one you’ll be reporting to. It’s every company’s imperative to continuously innovate and improve on their customer experience: InVision’s platform, education, and community enable creative collaboration across teams and geographies for improved speed-to-market and powerful business results. </p>\n<p>More than 7 million people across global enterprises and small teams come to us when they are looking for digital transformation. That process doesn’t start and end in any design tool: it encompasses ideation, conversation, visual collaboration and so much more. Teams use InVision to create, prototype and test new ideas; develop repeatable and streamlined processes in design, product and engineering; and improve workflows to move more efficiently from inspiration to production and drive innovation. The InVision platform allows teams to collaborate throughout the process with every stakeholder, giving individuals the visibility and know-how they require. We have built a curated interview process with that in mind. As you make your way through the interview journey, you will meet members of the team that represent our Engineering organization, our teams are broken up into these core areas: </p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Integrations:</strong> Allows InVision products to easily integrate with other design, development, and productivity tools such as Sketch, Atlassian, MSFT Teams, Slack, and more.</li>\n<li><strong>Freehand: </strong>Our online whiteboarding tool that is growing exponentially and beloved for its simplicity and ease of use. We are looking for the best and brightest who share our passion for travellers, data, and product. </p>\n<p><a href="http://findhotel.net/" rel="nofollow" title="http://findhotel.net/">FindHotel</a> believes travel is the one thing that really opens minds to new ideas, cultures, and ways of thinking. Our mission is to get every traveller in the world the best accommodation deal. From adventure travel and backpacking to honeymoons and family vacations, we deeply care so that every traveller can make the best-informed accommodation choice at the absolute best conditions for every trip.</p>\n<p>We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated <strong>Back-End Engineer</strong> to help build the most scalable and flexible APIs in the industry. You will be joining FindHotel’s Marketplace Platform Tribe. You will be working with other squads across tribes and closely interact and actively collaborate with the Software Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientist, and PO in the team.</p>\n<p>We are working with a modern stack consisting of Go, Redis, AWS (ElastiCache, ECS, S3, Batch), Snowflake, and more. We process thousands of requests per second and integrate with many suppliers and other partners. The products developed by the Offers team are a core part of FindHotel’s platform allowing us to offer the best possible comparison and offers to every traveller, worldwide. Hence, anything that you will develop and ship on production will have an immediate effect on our users and on our business performance. We work in a flexible, results-oriented and customer-centric team structure, focussed on shipping value in a collaborative fashion, with hopefully just the right amount of bureaucracy.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What you will actually be doing / responsibilities</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Work in a team to solve challenging problems, and design and develop products that will help to bring to our travellers the best deals available in the market.</li>\n<li>Identify bottlenecks and opportunities for improvements in terms of performance, reliability, and code quality.</li>\n<li>Integrate and improve (new) provider integrations.</li>\n<li>Help to maintain and improve our infrastructure and scale it to support our continuous growth in a cost-effective way.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What a day in the office might look like</strong></p>\n<p>In the morning, you and your fellow engineers have a refinement session with the PO to discuss the upcoming features on the roadmap. You carefully consider the impact of the new feature on the entire product and raise questions and make suggestions of what is the most pragmatic approach to balance the technical excellence with the time to market. You are part of a discussion that builds on top of each other suggestions, ideas and comments. Today you have chosen to come to the office and after lunch you play table tennis or pool or go for a walk with colleagues in the city centre. In the afternoon, you enter a deep work period and finish working on improving a core component in the rates and availability API. Once down with that work you jump on a zoom call with the rest of the team to discuss the challenges and next steps with the PoC the team is building in this sprint. Throughout the day you monitor the product operations using DataDog.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Who we are looking for / requirements</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>You hold a BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field</li>\n<li>You have a proven track record of designing, developing and shipping highly scalable software</li>\n<li>You have a proven track record working in a fast-paced agile environment</li>\n<li>You have strong experience with at least two programming languages such as GoLang, C#, Java</li>\n<li>Experience with GoLang is a plus</li>\n<li>You have experience with caching and setting up data pipelines.</li>\n<li>Experience working with data analysts and data scientist on analyzing data and identifying improvements is a plus</li>\n<li>You have experience with distributed systems</li>\n<li>You have experience with AWS, Terraform, and CI/CD tools.</li>\n<li>You have a sense of pragmatism, constantly finding the right balance between achieving technical excellence and delivering value to the end-users.</li>\n<li>You are flexible, curious, and independent, with a strong sense of ownership</li>\n<li>You treat documentation as a first-class citizen.</li>\n<li>You have excellent verbal and written communication skills</li>\n<li>You have a can-do and can-learn attitude</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Why join now?</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>This year we will be helping +2M customers around the world find better hotel deals, using data, transparency &amp; industry-leading features</li>\n<li>We are in fast growth mode and have been growing bookings by +100% YOY for the past 2 years and still growing in 2020 despite the pandemic</li>\n<li>Completing our mission means building an efficient tool users love. Doing that in a market as large and as competitive as online accommodation is a rare opportunity to make an impact in the online world.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Is FindHotel is the right place for you? we measure results, not time spent in the office.</li>\n<li>You will be part of a <a href="http://blog.findhotel.net/2016/12/global-perspectives/" rel="nofollow" title="http://blog.findhotel.net/2016/12/global-perspectives/">highly international team</a> in a fun work environment.</li>\n<li>We value good food and offer catered lunches from various cuisines, great coffee, ice-cream in the fridge and the occasional bbq in our garden</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Blog posts worth reading:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://blog.findhotel.net/2018/05/managing-aws-infrastructures-our-own-way/" rel="nofollow" title="http://blog.findhotel.net/2018/05/managing-aws-infrastructures-our-own-way/">Managing AWS infrastructures our own way</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://blog.findhotel.net/2019/05/the-hiring-process-at-findhotel/" rel="nofollow" title="https://blog.findhotel.net/2019/05/the-hiring-process-at-findhotel/">Our hiring process</a></li>\n</ul>\n NaN

Customers including Intel, Ubisoft, Samsung, Cigna, BNP, European Commission, Social Security Administration, and Affirm use Mattermost to enable their teams to collaborate securely and privately anywhere. Many of the world’s leading privacy-conscious enterprises like The US Department of Defense work better by connecting people, tools, and automation to increase developer collaboration using Mattermost. Our private cloud messaging platform offers secure, configurable, highly scalable messaging using web, mobile, and desktop applications and provides deep integrations with hundreds of SaaS and on-premises tools and applications. </div>\n<div> </div>\n<div>We value high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on customer success. You will be responsible for the implementation of additional application security tooling and/or processes across the company and coordinate with relevant stakeholders, gather requirements, and lead the implementation.</div>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Responsibilities:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Ownership of vulnerability management and mitigation static/dynamic code analysis</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Architecture and review of security components</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Provide security training and outreach to internal development teams</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Develop security guidance documentation</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Support the development of our application security program</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Maintain and grow our bug bounty program</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Required Background/Skill:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related fields, or significant professional application security experience</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Familiarity with common security libraries, security controls, and common security flaws </li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience with static/dynamic analysis, and common exploit tools and methods</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience in one or more programming languages, ideally Go or Javascript</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Comfortable with using Git</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Demonstrable teamwork skills and resourcefulness</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Linux experience</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h3"> </div>\n<div class="h3">Preferred Background/Skill:</div>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience working in open source communities</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Experience with OWASP 221 473645 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/software-dev/full-stack-developer-473645 Full Stack Developer avant arte Software Development [] full_time 2021-02-23T01:39:36 Europe Only <p><strong><em>ABOUT AVANT ARTE</em></strong></p>\n<p>Avant Arte wants to make art radically more accessible for a new generation.</p>\n<p>We started as a cult blog of contemporary artists, initially inspired through rap lyrics and hip-hop album covers. That blog grew organically into the world’s largest and most engaged online art community, with more than 2 million of their followers under the age of 35.<br>We collaborate with iconic contemporary artists like Jenny Holzer, Cai Guo-Qiang, Claire Tabouret and the Chapman brothers, making their work more accessible to younger collectors through sculpture editions, print editions and unique works on paper. And we have built a highly engaged community of next-generation art collectors, which means Avant Arte’s artist launches are heavily oversubscribed, with many behaving more like fashion drops, selling out in under 30 seconds. <br>The company’s vision is to inspire a generation of millions of young people who love art like they love music and who collect works like they build their wardrobe.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong><em>OUR CULTURE</em></strong></p>\n<p>We’re a small team with really big ambitions, both for what we want to achieve and also the environment we’re building. We want to create a company that remains thoughtful as we scale and tries to be genuinely progressive in how we operate; we want people to really own what they do and be given the autonomy and freedom to make mistakes, learn, and create something meaningful. We all work incredibly hard because we really care about what Avant Arte is here to do – we’re looking for exceptional people who are proactive, hungry to learn and want to put their pride in our collective achievements.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong><em>WHAT WE NEED</em></strong></p>\n<p>We are looking to add a skilled Full Stack Developer to our small but rapidly growing cross-functional product team.</p>\n<p>You will help to define, and be involved across, our technology stack and will thoughtfully and incrementally create new features and products that delight our customers and help drive our business towards an ambitious vision. This is a role that will be challenging and rewarding in equal measure, while providing high levels of autonomy during an incredibly exciting phase of growth.</p>\n<p>We’re looking for someone with a strong development background and proven track record in delivering well-crafted software. You will be someone who can lean on past experiences to help solve complex problems, while always being open to new approaches and technologies.</p>\n<p>As one of our first engineering hires you will have a pivotal role in moving our technology platform forward. We currently run a hybrid Shopify &amp; WordPress setup but have ambitious plans to move towards a modern web technology stack.</p>\n<p>As an early-stage business, your work will include many opportunities to be part of conversations about more than just technology – including design, data science and product strategy – but the core of your role will involve:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Design and implementation of scalable and performant applications.</li>\n<li>Owning code across our stack, with no limits on what you work on – from backend services (with GraphQL) to front-end web apps in React/Redux</li>\n<li>Participating in architectural and software development activities.</li>\n<li>Contributing to the definition of the product roadmap, helping to define requirements and come up with creative solutions to business problems.</li>\n<li>Taking responsibility for supporting your changes through the development lifecycle all the way through to production.</li>\n<li>Take part in We work holistically with our client partners as a true extension of their product team, not just as the technical execution arm of their business. If we see something broken, whether that's a workflow, a marketing or messaging strategy, or a needless feature, we speak up, and our clients trust us to help them fix it.</p>\n<p>Because we're more than just designers and developers, we achieve results that bring successful long-term partnerships and trusted referrals. We help entrepreneurs <em>build a business</em> ―not just an app. This approach, coupled with realistic and incremental software releases results in a friendly, fun, and collaborative atmosphere where our colleagues and clients both have room to learn and grow.</p>\n<p>See how our clients <a href="http://headway.io/case-studies/rise/" rel="nofollow">talk</a> about <a href="http://headway.io/compass/" rel="nofollow">our approach</a> and check out some of the <a href="http://headway.io/blog/2018-addys/" rel="nofollow">recognition we've received</a> so far. Discover how we show our clients appreciation with unique <a href="http://headway.io/blog/holiday-collaboration-with-velodrome-coffee/" rel="nofollow">holiday gifts</a> each year. We're excited about what we've achieved in the last few years, but we're just getting started. We need your help to take us to the next level!</p>\n<div class="h2"> </div>\n<div class="h2"><strong>A Day In The Life</strong></div>\n<p>During a typical work week, our crew members enjoy a balanced assignment of 35 hours on client projects with the ability to invest the other 5 hours on a combination of individual goals and team meetings. Twice a year, we take a full week away from client work to focus on team goals and internal project initiatives. These weeks alternate between a retreat style destination that encourages team bonding and goal setting, and a more focused week-long design and development sprint at our primary office in Wisconsin. Check out some of our <a href="http://headway.io/blog/headway-winter-retreat-2018/" rel="nofollow">team</a> week <a href="http://headway.io/blog/headway-team-week-july-2018/" rel="nofollow">recaps</a> and <a href="http://headway.io/blog/a-look-back-at-2017/" rel="nofollow">years in review</a> to get a feel for how much fun it is to work at Headway!</p>\n<div class="h2"> </div>\n<div class="h2"><strong>What Does Success Look Like?</strong></div>\n<p>During your first 2-4 weeks at Headway, you'll have an opportunity to meet with lots of crew members across the company and start to understand our unique approach to product development. This includes several "Headway 101" sessions that cover everything from our project management style, to our design aesthetic and business analysis approach, to development tools and techniques. If you're new to one of our tech stacks, we'll also create a customized trail of exercises to help get you up to speed. This training covers fundamentals of our core technologies, the way we delegate tasks within a development team, our git process and workflow, testing strategies, tips for successful client interactions, and much more.</p>\n<p>After this initial period, you'll be successfully contributing to new feature work on a client project in the context of a team. You'll also be participating in daily standups, sprint planning meetings, and retrospectives. <strong><em>Welcome aboard!</em></strong></p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Ongoing Support</strong></p>\n<p>Each week, you'll meet with your team lead to ensure that you have the time and attention you need to be successful. Your needs and questions will always come first in this meeting, but other topics discussed include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Individual quarterly goal progress</li>\n<li>Project status / team issues / weekly retro</li>\n<li>Individual responses to our weekly team health questionnaire</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Quarterly and Annual Reviews</strong></p>\n<p>In addition to weekly touch point meetings, more formal quarterly reviews are scheduled to discuss successes and areas for growth identified over the last 3 months. We have annual performance assessments and salary reviews, though we reserve the right to provide a merit based pay raise at any time. Most crew members achieve between a 2% and 5% raise each year within their same role, but bigger jumps are possible when roles or responsibilities increase. We're here to grow with you sustainably over the long term.</p>\n<div class="h2"> </div>\n<div class="h2"><strong>Experience and Results At Every Level</strong></div>\n<p>With an experienced leadership team encompassing design, development, sales, marketing, product, and operations, Headway is poised for an amazing 2021. Our business is guided by <a href="https://www.eosworldwide.com/eos-model" rel="nofollow">EOS</a> and we have strong processes, documentation, and people to support your growth and development. As they say, “Train people well enough so they can leave, treat them well enough so they don't want to.” For more on that, check out our benefits!</p>\n<div class="h2"> </div>\n<div class="h2"><strong>Why Should You Apply?</strong></div>\n<ul>\n<li>Work on exciting projects in the latest tech across a variety of industries including: Healthcare, FinTech, Logistics &amp; You diligently develop features and functionality, guided by Headway's process to ensure each release is successful. This role requires constant learning and a growth mindset.</p>\n<p>When communicating with clients during sprint planning, retros, and release demos, you help monitor features as project requirements change, and direct emergent requirement discussions back to the core focus of a minimum viable product (MVP). user story mapping and MoSCoW prioritization.</li>\n<li>Assisting with development critiques and QA.</li>\n<li>Performing pull request (PR) reviews.</li>\n<li>Participating in pairing sessions to help crewmates learn and grow.</li>\n<li>Performing QA of both internal code quality and external end-user UI/UX.</li>\n<li>Contributing to release notes.</li>\n<li>Participating in sprint planning sessions and retros while taking notes collaboratively alongside the rest of the team.</li>\n</ol>\n<p><strong><em>Help us make a difference, make waves, and make Headway!</em></strong></p>\n<div Casper can accommodate private, public, and hybrid network solutions, ensuring an optimized set of solutions for businesses, institutions, and individual application teams. Casper is powered by the Highway Protocol, a “correct-by-construction” specification that ensures security, functionality, and liveness through PoS. Casper is currently in its final incentivized testnet phase and will launch mainnet in March 2021.</p>\n<p>CasperLabs is building a Pro-Services team to facilitate the adoption of Casper blockchain within enterprises by building real-world applications for them. The Pro-Services team is responsible for working with CasperLabs many enterprise clients to solve their real-world business challenges by designing and implementing solutions leveraging Casper blockchain technology and integrating with other enterprise applications to provide a comprehensive solution.</p>\n<p>We are looking for a talented Project Manager to join the CasperLabs Pro-Services team. 233 452849 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/software-dev/lead-engineer-452849 Lead Engineer Process Street Software Development [] full_time 2021-02-16T01:39:44 North America Only <p>We’re searching for exceptional engineers in <strong>Pacific to Eastern Time Zones</strong> in North America.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>What We Build</strong></p>\n<p>We believe the way most teams capture their knowledge today is broken. Knowledge belongs where the action happens – not in documents hidden in a virtual filing cabinet.</p>\n<p>Process Street is where teams bring their operational knowledge to life using rich, automated playbooks. Often described as checklists with superpowers, our platform enables you to build, run, and gather insights for all your team's recurring workflows.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About Us</strong></p>\n<p>Global across 10 countries and 100% remote for over five years now, we were founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the 9-to-5.</p>\n<p>And we're backed by amazing investors like Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About You</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>You want agency.</strong> We practice Basecamp's <a href="%22https:/basecamp.com/shapeup%22" rel="nofollow">Shape Up</a> process, and run 6-week cycles and 2-week cooldowns. For the 6-week cycles, PMs provide a problem statement and some guidelines – no tickets, no detailed specs, no hi-fidelity solutions, and no estimates. Designers and engineers are trusted to craft the best solution possible in the cycle using user research, data, experience, and grit. During the 2-week cooldowns, you have the autonomy to work on what's important <em>to you –</em> including code maintainability or making the team faster. If a lot of responsibility, freedom, and ambiguity sounds refreshing, this role is for you.</li>\n<li><strong>You're well-versed in JavaScript and Scala (or Java/C#).</strong> Process Street is built on Scala/Play 2, AngularJS, React, Redux, Postgres, Serverless, and AWS. If you've scaled backend services beyond a monolith, you're an ideal candidate for this role. Experience with Scala is ideal, but not required. If you have Java or C# experience, you should apply.</li>\n<li><strong>You love to ship.</strong> We move fast. We deploy continuously behind feature flags, and release to customers at the end of every cycle. We utilize CI/CD and maintain ~70% test coverage.</li>\n<li><strong>You love process, but loathe meetings, bureaucracy, and ceremony.</strong> We think process is a tool. Used well, it makes us a better, faster team. But when it's not doing that, we drop it. We avoid unnecessary meetings whenever possible. A typical week for our engineers and designers has fewer than 5 hours of meetings.</li>\n<li><strong>You want to have a big impact.</strong> We're a small team and we're still early stage. We don't have designated areas of responsibility, and everyone wears the product hat. Every cycle brings new challenges, and your sphere of influence is wide. You love the variety and don't want to be shackled to a single project for years.</li>\n<li><strong>You have seven (7) or more years of experience in software development.</strong> We will hire in a range of levels for this position. So if the role excites you, and you have seven years of experience, but don't have the exact title listed here, you should apply.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Our Hiring Process</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>No all-day interview marathons.</strong> We use Calendly links to let you schedule interviews at the most convenient times for <em>you</em>.</li>\n<li><strong>No lengthy take-home projects.</strong> That said, we do a collaborative coding exercise in an IDE-like environment during our interviews. It's more focused on how you approach your work than the code itself.</li>\n<li><strong>No puzzles, algorithms, or gotcha questions.</strong> Our coding or design exercises are what you'd expect to do in a real-world on-the-job scenario.</li>\n<li><strong>We don't hire everyone that passes.</strong> We care more that Process Street is going to be a fit for you. We know that our teammates aren't cogs in a machine, and you won't be interviewed like one.</li>\n<li><strong>For us, diversity isn't just a buzzword.</strong> We actively focus on inclusivity and strongly encourage candidates who bring more diversity of opinion, experience, and background to apply.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Our Benefits</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Fully remote team</strong> – No offices, no commute, forever.</li>\n<li><strong>Unlimited PTO policy</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Annual company offsite</strong>* – (When not in a pandemic. We're doing a virtual one this year!)</li>\n<li><strong>Social time</strong> <em>–</em> We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections.</li>\n<li><strong>Generous health insurance for US employees and their families</strong></li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Diverse Teams Build Better Products</strong></p>\n<p>We strongly believe that diversity contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better products. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it.</p>\n<p>Process Street does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. We support workplace diversity.</p>\n NaN
234 459958 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/software-dev/java-selenium-developer-459958 Java Selenium Developer HICX Solutions Software Development [] full_time 2021-02-15T01:40:21 UK Only <p>HICX is a leading worldwide provider of enterprise SaaS solutions for digital supplier management. <a href="https://hicx-solutions.breezy.hr/" rel="nofollow">Learn more about HICX</a></p>\n<p>We are looking to expand our team by adding a highly capable and motivated Java developer to help us maintain and grow our automated testing capabilities. You will be part of a fast-growing team working working closely with the Engineering, Quality , Devops and Support departments.</p>\n<p>HICX has its own in-house built System Testing platform, based on Java (swing ui) and Selenium. The name of this tool is Talos.<br>Talos consumes test-case definition scripts which are maintained and constantly updated by the Quality Team. These are essentially sets of commands combined with test-data, which Talos reads and executes with a browser of choice to interact with our SaaS product and, enter data, carry out modifications and assert against the expected state.<br>You will be coding in JAVA and Javascript to update those commands, as new functionality is introduced in the system or a user-interface change breaks it.<br>Furthermore, you will be writing code for new commands that will be executing more complex and effective assertions, empowering the Quality team to use them in their scripts and as a result increase our coverage and our confidence in the system.</p>\n<p>Apart from the user-controlled mode, Talos also support fully automated Test-Cycles and reporting triggered from new deployments (these are setup by the Devops team as part of the CI/CD pipelines).<br>You will be maintaining/enhancing this functionality, by making sure Talos can continue execution, recovering from a failed step (to the extend possible), so that all the testcases defined can run fully on auto-pilot, without any human interaction.</p>\n<p>The successful candidate will strengthen our existing platform and help establish and maintain a robust fully-automated test workflow that can identify issues as soon as they are introduced in the codebase, before they reach the customer in production.</p>\n<p>You will have a lot of support from several technical and operations teams/departments and you'll get to make a big positive impact on a key focus area for one of the fastest growing and most innovative companies in the sector.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Maintaining the code of our Selenium-based in-house automated testing platform.</li>\n<li>Creating new commands to cover more system functionality and assertions</li>\n<li>Making sure the Automated testing platform runs the full Test-Suite as part of the standard CI/CD pipelines</li>\n<li>Working closely with the Quality Assurance team, making sure they can write the tests cases for the Automated Testing tool and that they can use it to execute System Testing cycles efficiently.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Proven working experience with full stack Java development.</li>\n<li>Hands on experience with Selenium Browser Our mission is to shake up higher education and make reading materials more accessible and learning more effective. We do this by making textbooks and monographs more affordable for students, so that in most cases, they are included in tuition costs. We have incorporated accessibility features to accommodate multiple learning styles and the different needs and preferences of each student.</p>\n<p>BibliU has grown rapidly, and during this time we have created Europe's largest digital education content programme, in partnership with Coventry University. Upon entering the US market, we have secured the largest digital textbook programmes in the US with Phoenix and Grand Canyon Universities.</p>\n<p>We are working with over 60% of universities in the United Kingdom, and are steadily growing in the US . We have recently raised $10 million in a Series A investment round (you can read more about this on<a href="https://news.sky.com/story/innovation-agency-nesta-backs-uk-edtech-start-up-bibliu-11974089" rel="nofollow"> Sky News</a> and<a href="https://www.edsurge.com/news/2020-04-17-bibliu-raises-10-million-to-scale-online-textbooks" rel="nofollow"> EdSurge</a>) and have ambitious plans for continued growth and expansion.</p>\n<p>Our team of 60+, of which half the senior management team are women, are currently seeking engineers to work within a global, cross-functional, product-driven team.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>About the teams</strong></p>\n<p>At BibliU we operate with a number of different Engineering teams. You would be joining either the Library team or the Content &amp; Scalability team, depending on your interests and depending on your timezone. These two teams often collaborate on features but are self-sufficient and responsible for different services within our stack.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>The Institution Engineering Team</strong></p>\n<p>The main responsibilities of this team are to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Build out our product offering for librarians at a number of universities and educational institutions</li>\n<li>Build integrations with third party software, identity providers and customer APIs</li>\n<li>Maintain a healthy development stack</li>\n<li>Develop technical solutions to allow internal teams to configure, sell and support our product</li>\n</ul>\n<div class="h1"> </div>\n<div class="h1"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><strong>The Content Engineering Team</strong></span></div>\n<p>The team is responsible for:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Services that process the eBooks on the platform, so they can be rendered in the BibliU application,</li>\n<li>Services that process and expose the metadata and pricing information of content,</li>\n<li>Tools and other products (e.g. dashboards) that internal teams use,</li>\n<li>Building our services to scale with the ever growing needs of the industry in mind</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Benefits</strong></p>\n<p>Our benefits are all aimed at supporting a healthy work-life balance and cultivating a company culture where you can bring your whole, human self to work.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>43 days of holiday including public and bank holidays.</li>\n<li>Flexible working</li>\n<li>Annual company retreat</li>\n<li>Equal paternity and maternity cover</li>\n<li>Birthday day off (in addition to annual leave)</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Fostering community is important to us. The BibliU book club meets (virtually) every 6 weeks and we have an active Women's Network.</p>\n<p>We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds, experiences and identities to apply. You will be asked to assess and make recommendations about what should be refactored and the time/cost/benefit implications of those recommendations.</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>The ideal person will:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Have experience digging deep beneath the hood on each layer of modern web development.</li>\n<li>You've likely built or been a part of a team building sophisticated WordPress sites and feel very familiar with the new Gutenberg editor, including having created native blocks in JavaScript/React without relying on a tool like ACF.</li>\n<li>Have experience or familiarity with a variety of technologies:\n<ul>\n<li>Node.js</li>\n<li>React.js</li>\n<li>GraphQL\n<ul>\n<li>Apollo Client</li>\n<li>Apollo Server</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>Redux</li>\n<li>Webpack</li>\n<li>Docker</li>\n<li>Redis</li>\n<li>Storybook</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>Be comfortable working independently with a remote team. 270 432486 https://remotive.io/remote-jobs/software-dev/software-engineer-java-432486 Software Engineer - Java Canva Software Development [] 2021-01-31T21:39:43 <div>At Canva, we create tools that empower the world to design. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone, on every platform! Inspired by a team of talented thinkers, an amazing culture and remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world, one design at a time.</div><div><br></div><div>Since launch in August 2013 we have grown exponentially, amassing over 30 million active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 2 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we are capable of!</div><div><br></div><div><b>About our Software Engineering Team</b></div><div>Software engineering is the core of who we are at Canva. The Canva code base was built to scale from day one. This has allowed for a unique environment where engineers spend most of their time optimizing performance and releasing new features rather than fixing legacy code. With adherence to fundamentals and first principles, the team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, aiming to strike that carefully measured balance between getting things done and long-term maintainability of the code base and supporting infrastructure. </div><div><br></div><div>We promote a warm and collaborative work environment where engineers set big goals and are given the tools and support to achieve them. We also invite our engineers to contribute to the direction their peers are taking with proactive pair-ups for peer-reviewing of code as well as regular engineering forums for opinions and ideas to be heard. These practices ensure that knowledge is shared and releases are quick and efficient. (For a deeper look into Canva's engineering culture, <a class="postings-link" href="https://medium.com/canva/engineering/home" rel="nofollow">here's a medium page</a>, discussing how we get things done.) </div><div><br></div><div>Finally - you're probably curious about our technology stack. At a high level, Canva's backend is powered by a set of services (some micro, some not-so-micro) built primarily in <b>Java</b>, hosted on<b> Linux</b>, sitting on <b>AWS. </b> We also sprinkle in some powerful open-source libraries and tools (have a look at <a class="postings-link" href="https://twitter.github.io/finagle/" rel="nofollow">finagle</a>), as well as bespoke components to power some of the magic.</div><div><br></div><div>In the Philippines, we are growing our existing engineering team. Here’s a glimpse of our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b25WG9uyecg" rel="nofollow">engineering culture</a> and a <a class="postings-link" href="https://product.canva.com/engineering-across-borders/" rel="nofollow">blog</a> about how we work across borders. </div><br><br><div class="h3">What you'll do as our Sr. Software Engineer:</div><ul><li><b>Solution Design and Software development.</b> You will be working closely with leads, designers, and product managers to deliver features and functionality to our customers all over the world.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Creation of a ticketing tooling system. </b>Experience in creating a ticketing tooling system is a plus as our engineering team will be working on integration of data information with Jira Service Desk along with creation of custom plug-ins and add ons. </li></ul><ul><li><b>Develop and iterate technical proposals</b>. You will also be responsible for outlining how solutions will be structured and developed whilst working collaboratively with the product engineering team. </li></ul><ul><li><b>Deployment to production release.</b> Having a hand on technical proposals and developing solutions you’ve designed from the ground up through to deployment and production release. </li></ul><ul><li><b>Identify and address performance bottlenecks. </b>Provide solutions and in improving current performance and bottlenecks within the application and broader infrastructure. </li></ul><ul><li><b>High accountability for the reliability of your solution.</b> We care about reliability greatly as your code is going to be used by millions of people. This means being responsible for the reliability of your solution, including monitoring and responding to incidents. </li></ul><ul><li>Performance debugging, benchmarking and building awesome things in general!</li></ul><ul><li>Participating in product meetings, hiring interviews and code reviews</li></ul><div><br></div><div>Once you’ve settled in and have a comfortable grasp of the product, environment, and processes, you’ll be given more responsibility and start leveraging your previous experience — bringing new ideas to the table concerning everything from feature development, process improvement, and product suggestions.</div><br><br><div class="h3">Required experience and skills: </div><ul><li>3+ years of experience as a backend engineer</li></ul><ul><li>Commercial experience developing complex web applications</li></ul><ul><li>Strong background using Java. But, we’re pragmatic and flexible – we’ll use whatever makes the most sense to complete a task (previous experience with other languages is great!)</li></ul><ul><li>Experience/knowledge on Spring and Spring Boot</li></ul><ul><li>Experience in Agile Software Development</li></ul><ul><li>Firmly grounded computer science and engineering fundamentals including concurrency, multithreading, data structures, solution design, architecture, and design patterns. You’d be surprised how often these things come up here at Canva!</li></ul><ul><li>You’re happy to roll the sleeves up and dive into java.util.concurrent from time to time 🙂</li></ul><ul><li>Working collaboratively with team members and communicating effectively </li></ul><ul><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal </li></ul><br><br><div class="h3">Benefits</div><ul><li><b>HMO with 2 Dependents</b> on <b>Day 1</b></li></ul><ul><li>Equity options in one of the fastest growing startups in the world</li></ul><ul><li>Professional educational allowance - we care about <b>your </b>growth</li></ul><ul><li>Fitness membership</li></ul><ul><li>In-house chef</li></ul><ul><li>Sponsored social clubs and team events</li></ul><ul><li>Fun and quirky celebrations</li></ul><div><br></div><div><i>Note: This is a full-time remote work until there's a need to move back to onsite office operations.</i></div><div>Canva is ranked #3 Great Place to work in the Philippines and is one of the leading technology companies in Australia. </div><div><br></div><div>Our culture is unlike anywhere else and our offices are designed with workspaces for every mood, to help you do great work. At Canva you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really love. </div><div><br></div><div><b>Being a Force for good.</b> </div><div>One of our core values at Canva, “Being a force for good” means we are actively working towards a world that isn't just good for a small few, but one that’s good for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community. It combines the power of graphs, JSON documents and a key-value store with a full-text search engine. ArangoDB makes all of your data models accessible with a single elegant declarative query language. Developers can build high-performance applications using a convenient SQL-like query language or JavaScript extensions. Oh, and did we mention it is open source?</p>\n<p>Our goal is to make working with data easy. And because we want to make it simpler for others, we work on solving complex problems. We are looking for an experienced <strong>Senior </strong><strong>C++ Developer</strong> with a deep understanding of large-scale distributed systems to join our core team.<br><br>Our headquarter is in San Francisco (US), we have an office in Cologne (Germany), but most of our diverse team works remote worldwide. So do you prefer your desk at home or do you want to join us at one of our locations? Your choice.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Your Role:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>You will be part of the team responsible for the development of the core components of the ArangoDB database</li>\n<li>You design and implement distributed transactions, distributed queries, network communication and much more</li>\n<li>You optimize performance for all core components, especially database queries and transaction processing</li>\n<li>And work closely and collaboratively with team members on code reviews, and cross-functional projects</li>\n</ul>\n<p> </p>\n<p><strong>Your Skills:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>You have experience working on large-scale distributed systems</li>\n<li>You are willing to develop in C++</li>\n<li>You have a solid algorithmic background, either through experience or a background in Computer Science</li>\n<li>You communicate pro-active and friendly with team members as well as customers</li>\n<li>Bonus points for experience with open source storage engines like RocksDB</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The over 50 minds of ArangoDB come from 4 different continents and over a dozen countries.
